      42             : static a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr
      43             :                 struct_stmt_stack_container;
      44             :                         /* A dynamically allocated array of structured
      45             :                            statement stack entries that can accommodate
      46             :                            the coexistence of more than one stack.  When a
      47             :                            stack is currently active and a new stack is
      48             :                            required (for member function definitions of
      49             :                            local classes, for instance) an unused segment of
      50             :                            the container is employed; later the inactive
      51             :                            stack can be reactivated.  Because the container
      52             :                            is dynamically allocated, it can be expanded if
      53             :                            necessary.  size_struct_stmt_stack_container
      54             :                            gives the number of elements currently allocated.
      55             :                            Allocation is not per-file. */
      56             : static sizeof_t size_struct_stmt_stack_container;
      57             :                         /* Size of struct_stmt_stack_container, in terms of
      58             :                            the number of elements. */
      59             : #define STRUCT_STMT_STACK_INCREMENTAL_ALLOCATION 30
      60             :                         /* The number of elements added to struct_stmt_stack
      61             :                            each time it is reallocated; also the initial
      62             :                            allocation. */
      63             : 
      64             : static a_reachability_summary
      65             :                 curr_reachability;
      66             :                         /* Indicates whether or not the current location in
      67             :                            the code (following the last statement of the top
      68             :                            structured statement on the statement stack) is
      69             :                            reachable by flowing into it from the previous
      70             :                            statement. */
      71             : 
      72             : static a_control_flow_descr_ptr
      73             :                 control_flow_descr_list;
      74             :                         /* A linked list that represents that part of the
      75             :                            static control flow pattern of a given function
      76             :                            that is relevant to detecting transfers of control
      77             :                            that bypass declarations with explicit or implicit
      78             :                            initializers.  The list represents labels, gotos,
      79             :                            blocks, and initializing declarations.  Note that
      80             :                            the list is dynamically pruned -- it has only
      81             :                            enough information on it for the checking that is
      82             :                            required.  For instance, once a block is closed,
      83             :                            it may be removed from the list entirely if it is
      84             :                            not relevant to subsequent analysis.  Similarly,
      85             :                            once a forward goto has been checked, it is no
      86             :                            longer interesting and is removed.  Some of the
      87             :                            entries on the list point to IL entries, but the
      88             :                            IL does not point back.  It is for front-end use
      89             :                            only. */
      90             : static a_control_flow_descr_ptr
      91             :                 end_of_control_flow_descr_list;
      92             :                         /* Pointer to the tail of control_flow_descr_list;
      93             :                            NULL only when control_flow_descr_list itself is
      94             :                            NULL. */
      95             : static a_control_flow_descr_ptr
      96             :                 avail_control_flow_descrs;
      97             :                         /* Linked list of a_control_flow_descr entries that
      98             :                            have been freed for reuse. */

     466           0 : static void db_cfd_with_indentation(a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp)
     467             : /*
     468             : Display a control flow description in a special format, for use when
     469             : dump_control_flow has been enabled at the command line.  The display line
     470             : includes the current sequence number, indentation corresponding to the depth
     471             : of parent block, and the control flow entry itself.
     472             : */
     473             : {
     474           0 :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  parent = cfdp->parent;
     475             : 
     476           0 :   fprintf(f_debug, "CF-%.4d    ", (int)pos_curr_token.seq);
     477           0 :   for (; parent != NULL; parent = parent->parent) {

     601       59618 : static void free_control_flow_descr(a_control_flow_descr_ptr cfdp)
     602             : /*
     603             : Return an entry of type a_control_flow_descr to the available list for reuse.
     604             : It will already have been removed from any other lists.  Note that the

     614        1152 : static void remove_list_of_control_flow_descrs(a_control_flow_descr_ptr  head,
     615             :                                                a_control_flow_descr_ptr  tail)
     616             : /*
     617             : Remove the list of control flow descriptors headed by head and terminated by
     618             : tail from control_flow_descr_list and add it onto the available list.  It
     619             : may be a sublist of the larger list, so link around it (both next and prev
     620             : pointers) and move the list as a whole to the available list.
     621             : */
     622             : {
     623        1152 :   db_enter(5, "remove_list_of_control_flow_descrs");

     625             : #if DEBUG
     626        1152 :     if (debug_level >= 5) {
     627           0 :       a_control_flow_descr_ptr cfdp = head;
     628           0 :       fprintf(f_debug, "Removing entire list:\n");

     630           0 :         fprintf(f_debug, "  ");

     632           0 :         db_cfd(cfdp);
     633           0 :         if (cfdp == tail) break;

     635           0 :         if (cfdp == NULL) {
     636           0 :           if (tail != NULL) {

     638           0 :             db_cfd(tail);
     639           0 :             break;
     640             :           }  /* if */

     642             :       }  /* for */
     643             :     }  /* if */

     722             : 
     723             : static a_boolean check_for_branch_into_goto_protected_block(
     724             :                                       a_control_flow_descr_ptr  label_cfdp,
     725             :                                       a_control_flow_descr_ptr  goto_cfdp)
     726             : /*
     727             : Check for an attempt to branch into a try block, a catch clause (an
     728             : exception handler), a C++/CLI finally clause, or a GNU statement expression.
     729             : Either label_cfdp points to a label entry and goto_cfdp to a goto entry, or
     730             : else label_cfdp points to a case label entry and goto_cfdp is NULL (in which
     731             : case we need to find the switch with which the case label is associated).  If
     732             : an error is found, issue the diagnostic and return TRUE.
     733             : */
     734             : {
     735             :   a_boolean                 err = FALSE;
     736             :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp;
     737             : 
     738             :   db_enter(4, "check_for_branch_into_goto_protected_block");

     740             :   if (cfdp->variant.block.is_within_goto_protected_block) {
     741             :     /* The label is inside a statement that cannot be branched into. */
     742             :     while (!cfdp->variant.block.is_catch_block &&
     743             :            !cfdp->variant.block.is_try_block &&
     744             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
     745             :            !cfdp->variant.block.is_finally_block &&
     746             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
     747             :            !cfdp->variant.block.is_constexpr_if &&
     748             :            !cfdp->variant.block.is_statement_expr) {
     749             :       cfdp = cfdp->parent;
     750             :       check_assertion(cfdp != NULL);
     751             :     }  /* while */
     752             :     if (goto_cfdp == NULL) {
     753             :       /* This must be a branch to a case label -- there's no explicit goto
     754             :          statement. */
     755             :       check_assertion(label_cfdp->kind ==
     756             :                              (a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_case_label);

     758             :          the implicit goto occurs. */
     759             :       goto_cfdp = label_cfdp->parent;
     760             :       while (!goto_cfdp->variant.block.is_switch_block) {
     761             :         goto_cfdp = goto_cfdp->parent;
     762             :         check_assertion(goto_cfdp != NULL);
     763             :       }  /* for */
     764             :     }  /* if */
     765             :     if (is_on_cfd_parent_list(cfdp, goto_cfdp)) {
     766             :       /* The catch or try block is a parent (or grandparent, etc.) of the
     767             :          block where the goto occurs.  A local branch within a single
     768             :          catch clause or try block is allowed. */
     769             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

     807             : 
     808             : 
     809           0 : static void report_switch_past_init(a_control_flow_descr_ptr  block,
     810             :                                     a_diagnostic_ptr          *prev_dp,
     811             :                                     an_error_severity         *prev_severity)
     812             : /*
     813             : This routine traverses the portion of the control_flow_descr_list associated
     814             : with "block", which is a switch block or a block contained within a switch
     815             : block, and looks for initializing declarations that may be bypassed by a
     816             : transfer of control to a case label.  Once the last case label in the
     817             : block has been reached, the search stops, since any subsequent initialization
     818             : cannot be jumped over (at least, not by the switch).  When an initialization
     819             : is found, a diagnostic is issued (an error in C++, a warning otherwise), and
     820             : *err is set to TRUE.  If *prev_severity is es_none, no diagnostic is in the
     821             : process of being generated.  If it not es_none, *prev_dp is the diagnostic
     822             : that is being generated.
     823             : */
     824             : {
     825           0 :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp, next_cfdp = NULL, parent;
     826           0 :   a_variable_ptr            vp;
     827           0 :   a_boolean                 done;
     828           0 :   an_error_severity         severity;
     829           0 :   a_type_ptr                tp;
     830           0 :   a_statement_ptr           sp;
     831             : 
     832             : 
     833           0 :   db_enter(4, "report_switch_past_init");
     834             : #if DEBUG
     835           0 :   if (debug_level >= 4) {
     836           0 :     fprintf(f_debug, "block = ");
     837           0 :     db_cfd(block);
     838             :   }  /* if */
     839             : #endif /* DEBUG */
     840             :   /* Start at the first entry within the block. */
     841           0 :   cfdp = block->next;
     842           0 :   done = FALSE;
     843           0 :   for (;;) {
     844           0 :     switch (cfdp->kind) {
     845           0 :       case cfdk_block:
     846             :         /* A nested block.  If it has any case labels (either directly
     847             :            contained or in a subblock) search for initializations. */
     848           0 :         next_cfdp = cfdp->variant.block.end_of_block->next;
     849           0 :         if (cfdp->variant.block.last_case_label != NULL) {
     850           0 :           report_switch_past_init(cfdp, prev_dp, prev_severity);
     851             :           /* All case labels will have been removed.  Is there any reason to
     852             :              keep this block around? */
     853           0 :           check_assertion(cfdp->variant.block.last_case_label == NULL);
     854           0 :           if (!cfdp->variant.block.any_labels &&
     855           0 :               cfdp->variant.block.goto_count == 0) {
     856             :             /* A block with no labels and no forward gotos. */
     857           0 :             remove_list_of_control_flow_descrs(cfdp, cfdp->variant.
     858             :                                                        block.end_of_block);
     859             :           }  /* if */
     860             :           /* Processing the subblock may mean the current block does not
     861             :              need to be searched any more.  For example:
     862             :                switch (i) {
     863             :                  case 1:
     864             :                    {                // start of subblock
     865             :                    int i = 0;       // diagnostic issued
     866             :                    case 2:
     867             :                    }                // end of subblock
     868             :                    int j = 0;       // no diagnostic (since decl is not
     869             :                }                    //   followed by another case label)
     870             :              In this example, the outer block is originally marked as having
     871             :              "case 2" as its last case label (even though it is contained
     872             :              within a subblock), but when case 2 is found, it is removed and
     873             :              the last_case_label fields of both the inner and outer block are
     874             :              set to NULL. */
     875           0 :           done = (block->variant.block.last_case_label == NULL);
     876             :         }  /* if */
     877             :         break;
     878           0 :       case cfdk_case_label:
     879             :         /* A case label. */
     880           0 :         if (cfdp == block->variant.block.last_case_label) {
     881             :           /* Moreover, the last case label in the current block.  No further
     882             :              checking in this block is required, so done is set to TRUE. */
     883           0 :           done = TRUE;
     884             :           /* Now that the case label has been seen (it's really just serving
     885             :              as a marker to tell us to stop searching for initializations),
     886             :              it can be removed from the list.  Therefore the last_case_label
     887             :              pointer in the current block should be set to NULL, as should
     888             :              the pointers to this case label in the parent chain. */
     889           0 :           block->variant.block.last_case_label = NULL;
     890           0 :           if (!block->variant.block.is_switch_block) {
     891           0 :             for (parent = block->parent; ; parent = parent->parent) {
     892           0 :               if (cfdp == parent->variant.block.last_case_label) {
     893           0 :                 parent->variant.block.last_case_label = NULL;
     894           0 :                 if (parent->variant.block.is_switch_block) break;
     895             :               } else {
     896             :                 break;
     897             :               }  /* if */
     898             :             }  /* for */
     899             :           }  /* if */
     900             :         } else {
     901             :           /* It's not the last case label in the block, so we keep searching,
     902             :              but the case label can still be removed. */
     903           0 :           next_cfdp = cfdp->next;
     904             :         }  /* if */
     905           0 :         remove_control_flow_descr(cfdp);
     906           0 :         break;
     907             :       case cfdk_end_of_block:
     908             :         /* End of block.  Only under rare circumstances should we get all
     909             :            the way to the end of the block before stopping. */
     910             :         done = TRUE;
     911             :         break;
     912           0 :       case cfdk_init:
     913             :         /* An initialization or (when support for VLAs is enabled) a VLA
     914             :            declaration.  Issue a diagnostic for automatic variables;
     915             :            initializations for which a diagnostic should not be issued will
     916             :            not be found, since we stop searching the block once its last case
     917             :            label has been seen. */
     918           0 :         sp = cfdp->variant.init.statement;
     919           0 :         vp = cfdp->variant.init.variable;
     920           0 :         severity = es_none;
     921           0 :         if (vp != NULL && !cfdp->variant.init.is_vla_variable) {
     922           0 :           if (!var_has_static_or_thread_storage_duration(vp)) {
     923           0 :             severity = es_warning;
     924           0 :             if (!C_mode()) {

    1006             : 
    1007             : 
    1008             : static void promote_label_and_goto_lifetimes(
    1009             :                                         a_control_flow_descr_ptr  block_cfdp,
    1010             :                                         an_object_lifetime_ptr    promote_from,
    1011             :                                         an_object_lifetime_ptr    promote_to)
    1012             : /*
    1013             : Loop through the entries in the list headed by block_cfdp, and for each
    1014             : goto and label statement with a lifetime matching promote_from, change it
    1015             : to point to the lifetime promote_to.
    1016             : */
    1017             : {
    1018             :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp;
    1019             :   a_statement_ptr           sp;
    1020             : 
    1021             :   /*lint --e{850} cfdp modified in loop */
    1022             :   for (cfdp = block_cfdp->next; cfdp != NULL; cfdp = cfdp->next) {
    1023             :     switch (cfdp->kind) {
    1024             :       case cfdk_goto:
    1025             :         /* Pull out the goto statement pointer. */
    1026             :         sp = cfdp->variant.goto_statement.ptr;
    1027             :         break;
    1028             :       case cfdk_label:
    1029             :         /* Pull out the label statement pointer. */
    1030             :         sp = cfdp->variant.label_statement;
    1031             :         break;
    1032             :       case cfdk_block:
    1033             :         if (cfdp->variant.block.goto_count > 0 ||
    1034             :             cfdp->variant.block.any_labels) {
    1035             :           /* Find the gotos and labels in the nested block and promote
    1036             :              their object lifetime pointers, too. */
    1037             :         } else {
    1038             :           /* Skip over the nested block. */
    1039             :           cfdp = cfdp->variant.block.end_of_block;
    1040             :         }  /* if */
    1041             :         /*FALLTHROUGH*/
    1042             :       default:
    1043             :         continue;
    1044             :     }  /* switch */
    1045             :     /* If the object lifetime pointer in the goto or label statement matches
    1046             :        promote_from, change it to refer to promote_to. */
    1047             :     if (sp->variant.label.lifetime == promote_from) {
    1048             :       sp->variant.label.lifetime = promote_to;
    1049             :     }  /* if */
    1050             :   }  /* for */
    1051             : }  /* promote_label_and_goto_lifetimes */
    1052             : 
    1053             : 
    1054       26079 : static void fixup_curr_block_labels_and_gotos(
    1055             :                                          a_control_flow_descr_ptr  block_cfdp)
    1056             : /*
    1057             : block_dfdp points to a control flow description that represents a block that
    1058             : is about to be terminated.  That means the lifetime associated with it (along
    1059             : with indirectly associated block-after-label lifetimes) will be popped from
    1060             : the object lifetime stack.  If any goto or label statement points to an object
    1061             : lifetime entry that is useless (that will not be retained in the IL), then
    1062             : the pointer must be "promoted" to refer to a lifetime that is still on the
    1063             : stack.  (Successive poppings of the structured statement stack may result in
    1064             : successive promotions of the lifetime associated with an inner-block label or
    1065             : goto.)  Here's an example:
    1066             :   void f()
    1067             :   {                     // function scope
    1068             :     {                   // block scope #1
    1069             :       {                 // block scope #2
    1070             :         goto L;
    1071             :       }
    1072             :   L:;
    1073             :     }
    1074             :   }
    1075             : When block scope #2 terminates, if there were no destructible objects declared
    1076             : in it, the lifetime for the goto statement is promoted to that of block scope
    1077             : #1.  Then, when block scope #1 terminates, the lifetimes of both the goto and
    1078             : the label are promoted to the lifetime of the function scope.
    1079             : */
    1080             : {
    1081       26079 :   an_object_lifetime_ptr  block_olp, promote_from = NULL, promote_to;
    1082       26079 :   a_boolean               keep_block_object_lifetime;
    1083             : 
    1084       26079 :   db_enter(4, "fixup_curr_block_labels_and_gotos");
    1085       26079 :   if (!block_cfdp->variant.block.is_switch_block) {
    1086       26078 :     block_olp = block_cfdp->variant.block.object_lifetime;
    1087       26078 :     check_assertion(block_olp != NULL &&
    1088             :                     block_olp->kind == (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block);
    1089       26078 :     if (block_cfdp->parent == NULL) {
    1090             :       /* block_cfdp must represent the function scope.  Don't try to promote
    1091             :          its lifetime. */
    1092             :       keep_block_object_lifetime = TRUE;
    1093        9234 :     } else if (block_olp->destructions != NULL) {
    1094             :       /* Don't promote the lifetime of an inner block if it has destructions
    1095             :          associated with it. */
    1096             :       keep_block_object_lifetime = TRUE;
    1097        9234 :     } else if (block_cfdp->variant.block.is_catch_block
    1098             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1099             :                || block_cfdp->variant.block.is_finally_block
    1100             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1101             :                                                             ) {
    1102             :       /* The lifetime of a try block, catch clause or finally clause is
    1103             :          retained in the IL, even if it has no destructions. */
    1104             :       keep_block_object_lifetime = TRUE;
    1105             :     } else {
    1106        8432 :       keep_block_object_lifetime = FALSE;
    1107             :     }  /* if */
    1108             :     /* Loop through any olk_block_after_label lifetimes that may belong to the
    1109             :        block that is being terminated. */
    1110       26080 :     while (curr_object_lifetime != block_olp) {
    1111           2 :       check_assertion(curr_object_lifetime->kind ==
    1112             :                               (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block_after_label);
    1113           2 :       promote_from = curr_object_lifetime;
    1114           2 :       promote_to = curr_object_lifetime->parent_lifetime;
    1115             :       /* Pop the block-after-label object lifetime.  If, after it's popped,
    1116             :          it's no longer in the IL, we'll need to promote pointers that
    1117             :          reference it. */
    1118           2 :       if (pop_object_lifetime()) {
    1119             :         /* Popping the object lifetime did not result in its being removed
    1120             :            from the IL, so labels and gotos that reference it don't need to
    1121             :            have their pointers updated.  This means the block lifetime will
    1122             :            be retained. */
    1123             :         keep_block_object_lifetime = TRUE;
    1124           2 :       } else if (block_cfdp->variant.block.goto_count != 0 ||
    1125             :                  block_cfdp->variant.block.any_labels) {
    1126             :         /* Promote the label and goto lifetime pointers. */
    1127           2 :         promote_label_and_goto_lifetimes(block_cfdp, promote_from, promote_to);
    1128             :       }  /* if */
    1129           2 :       check_assertion(promote_to == curr_object_lifetime);
    1130             :     }  /* while */
    1131             :     /* At this point all the promotions have been done for the subblocks
    1132             :        created by label declarations.  Now do the top-level lifetime of the
    1133             :        block -- if required. */
    1134       26078 :     if (block_cfdp->variant.block.goto_count != 0 ||
    1135             :         block_cfdp->variant.block.any_labels) {
    1136         725 :       block_olp->block_lifetime_with_label_or_goto = TRUE;
    1137         725 :       if (block_olp->parent_lifetime->kind ==
    1138             :                                 (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_expr_temporary) {
    1139             :         /* We can get here with GNU statement expressions.  However, we do not
    1140             :            want to promote a lifetime for a goto or label statement to be a
    1141             :            child of an olk_expr_temporary lifetime since that would complicate
    1142             :            things elsewhere. */
    1143             :         keep_block_object_lifetime = TRUE;
    1144             :       }  /* if */
    1145        1360 :       if (!keep_block_object_lifetime &&
    1146         635 :           is_useless_object_lifetime(block_olp)) {
    1147         635 :         promote_to = block_olp->parent_lifetime;
    1148         635 :         check_assertion_str2(
    1149             :                     promote_to->kind == (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block ||
    1150             :                     promote_to->kind ==
    1151             :                             (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block_after_label ||
    1152             :                     promote_to->kind == (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_try_block,
    1153             :                     "fixup_curr_block_labels_and_gotos:",
    1154         635 :                     "bad parent of curr block lifetime");
    1155         635 :         promote_label_and_goto_lifetimes(block_cfdp, block_olp, promote_to);
    1156             :         /* Null out the lifetime pointer in the block control flow entry.
    1157             :            "NULL" means that the lifetimes of any labels or statements within
    1158             :            are still subject to further promotion. */
    1159         635 :         block_cfdp->variant.block.object_lifetime = NULL;
    1160             :       }  /* if */
    1161             :     }  /* if */
    1162             :   }  /* if */
    1163       26079 :   db_exit();
    1164       26079 : }  /* fixup_curr_block_labels_and_gotos */
    1165             : 
    1166             : 
    1167             : static void remove_unneeded_set_vla_size_control_flow_entries(
    1168             :                                            a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp)
    1169             : /*
    1170             : Examine the control flow entries immediately preceding the indicated entry,
    1171             : which should point to a vla-decl statement.  Each preceding entry that is
    1172             : associated with a set-vla-size statement belonging to the same declaration
    1173             : as the vla-decl statement can be deleted.  For example,
    1174             :     void f(int n) {
    1175             :       int a[n];
    1176             :       typedef int T[n];
    1177             :       T b;
    1178             :     }
    1179             : The statements generated for this declaration are:
    1180             :     set-vla-size
    1181             :     vla-decl
    1182             :     set-vla-size
    1183             :     vla-decl
    1184             : and for each a cfdk_init control-flow entry is generated.  The first two
    1185             : statements belong to the declaration of a; the third and fourth to the
    1186             : declarations of T and b, respectively.  The control-flow entry pointing at
    1187             : the first set-vla-size statement is removed, but the one pointing at the
    1188             : second is not.  The reason for removing superfluous entries is to avoid
    1189             : issuing redundant errors for branching around the declarations.  (The
    1190             : set-vla-size statements are generated in declarator, which doesn't know what
    1191             : the context of the array declarator is; the simplest approach is just to put
    1192             : them out and then remove them if they prove superfluous.)
    1193             : */
    1194             : {
    1195             :   a_statement_ptr           sp, prev_sp;
    1196             :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  prev;
    1197             : 
    1198             :   sp = cfdp->variant.init.statement;
    1199             :   check_assertion(sp != NULL && sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_vla_decl);
    1200             :   /* A multidimensional array may have more than one variable dimension, and
    1201             :      so more than one set-vla-size statement.  Therefore the checking is done
    1202             :      inside a loop. */
    1203             :   for (;;) {
    1204             :     prev = cfdp->prev;
    1205             :     if (prev != NULL && prev->kind == (a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_init) {
    1206             :       prev_sp = prev->variant.init.statement;
    1207             :       if (prev_sp != NULL &&
    1208             :           prev_sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_set_vla_size) {
    1209             :         /* The preceding entry is indeed a cfdk_init that points to a
    1210             :            set-vla-size statement. */
    1211             :         a_type_ptr           tp = sp->variant.vla.variant.variable->type;
    1212             :         a_vla_dimension_ptr  vdp = prev_sp->variant.vla_dimension;
    1213             :         a_boolean            match = FALSE;
    1214             : 
    1215             :         /* Look at each dimension of the variable length array, looking for
    1216             :            a match with the set-vla-size statement. */
    1217             :         while (is_array_type(tp) &&
    1218             :                !(tp->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_typeref &&
    1219             :                  typeref_is_typedef(tp))) {
    1220             :           a_type_ptr  unqualified_tp = skip_typerefs(tp);
    1221             :           if (same_entities(vdp->type, unqualified_tp)) {
    1222             :             match = TRUE;
    1223             :             break;
    1224             :           }  /* if */
    1225             :           /* No match -- advance to the array element, which may itself be
    1226             :              an array. */
    1227             :           tp = array_element_type(tp);
    1228             :         }  /* while */
    1229             :         if (match) {
    1230             :           /* Remove the superfluous control-flow entry. */
    1231             :           remove_control_flow_descr(prev);
    1232             :           /* Continue the loop, in case there's another dimension to
    1233             :              check. */
    1234             :           continue;
    1235             :         }  /* if */
    1236             :       }  /* if */
    1237             :     }  /* if */
    1238             :     /* Assume one pass, unless there was a match and prev was removed from
    1239             :        the control flow list. */
    1240             :     break;
    1241             :   }  /* for */
    1242             : }  /* remove_unneeded_set_vla_size_control_flow_entries */
    1243             : 
    1244             : 
    1245       64398 : static void add_to_control_flow_descr_list(a_control_flow_descr_ptr  new_cfdp)
    1246             : /*
    1247             : Add new_cfdp to the end of control_flow_descr_list.  This typically involves
    1248             : setting its prev and parent pointers (its next pointer will be NULL), and
    1249             : setting end_of_control_flow_descr_list to point to it.  If it is a goto or
    1250             : label entry, its addition may produce changes to fields of parent (and
    1251             : grandparent, etc.) entries.  In some cases it will not be added to the list
    1252             : at all and will even cause other entries to be removed -- for instance, if
    1253             : appending an end-of-block entry will result in an empty block, or if the
    1254             : completed block would have no labels or gotos, the block can be eliminated,
    1255             : because such blocks are not relevant to detecting transfer of control past
    1256             : initializing declarations.
    1257             : */
    1258             : {
    1259       64398 :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp, prev_cfdp, prev_parent, parent;
    1260             : 
    1261       64398 :   db_enter(4, "add_to_control_flow_descr_list");
    1262             : #if DEBUG
    1263       64398 :   if (debug_level >= 4) {
    1264           0 :     fprintf(f_debug, "Candidate to add to list: ");
    1265           0 :     db_cfd(new_cfdp);
    1266             :   }  /* if */
    1267             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    1268       64398 :   if (control_flow_descr_list == NULL) {
    1269             :     /* Add this entry to the start of the list. */
    1270       18159 :     control_flow_descr_list = new_cfdp;
    1271             :   } else {
    1272       46239 :     prev_parent = end_of_control_flow_descr_list->parent;
    1273       46239 :     if (new_cfdp->kind == (a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_end_of_block) {

    1276       27498 :         if (!C_mode()) {

    1278             :              happen if this is inside a switch statement) they need to be
    1279             :              popped off the object lifetime stack. */

    1742       66368 : a_statement_ptr add_statement_at_stmt_pos(a_statement_kind   kind,

    1744             : /*
    1745             : Allocate a statement of the indicated kind, record the statement

    1775             : 
    1776             :   /* Allocate the statement entry. */
    1777       66368 :   sp = alloc_statement(kind);
    1778             :   /* Set the position from *stmt_pos. */
    1779       66368 :   sp->position = *stmt_pos;

    1782       66368 :   add_statement_list(sp, curr_reachability.reachable);

    1822        5370 : void update_init_statement_control_flow(a_statement_ptr  sp)

    1866             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    1867             : 
    1868        7752 : static void record_sse_for_decl_statement(a_statement_ptr  sp)
    1869             : /*
    1870             : Record a source sequence entry for the given stmk_decl statement.  Because
    1871             : such statements are decided after prescanning for declaration vs. expression
    1872             : ambiguities, the source sequence entry is not always recorded at the end of
    1873             : the list of source sequence entries for the current scope.  Also, the case
    1874             : of a stmk_decl entry created for a C++17 "if" or "switch" initializer needs
    1875             : extra care (since it is created after the declaration is fully scanned).
    1876             : */
    1877             : {
    1878        7752 :   a_boolean                      early_sses_present = FALSE;
    1879        7752 :   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr    move_to_point = NULL;
    1880        7752 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr  sssep = &struct_stmt_stack_top();
    1881             : 
    1882             :   /* Identify if any source sequence entries have been added during
    1883             :      declaration vs. expression disambiguation. */
    1884        7752 :   if (C_mode()) {
    1885             :     /* Nothing to do. */
    1886             :   } else {
    1887             :     /* We recorded the last source sequence entry emitted before starting
    1888             :        a look-ahead procedure that may have added additional entries.  The
    1889             :        new entry should be moved ahead of those additional entries. */
    1890        6987 :     a_source_sequence_entry_ptr  prev_last;
    1891        6987 :     prev_last = sssep->last_sse_before_expr_decl_disambiguation;
    1892        6987 :     if (prev_last != NULL) {
    1893        6098 :       if (prev_last->next != NULL) {
    1894             :         /* An entry was appended directly after the last one recorded before
    1895             :            disambiguation. */
    1896             :         early_sses_present = TRUE;
    1897             :         move_to_point = prev_last->next;
    1898        6098 :       } else if (scope_is(&scope_stack_top(), sck_condition) &&
    1899           0 :                  (sssep->kind == ssk_if ||
    1900           0 :                   sssep->kind == ssk_constexpr_if ||
    1901             :                   sssep->kind == ssk_switch)) {
    1902             :         /* A stmk_decl entry in a condition scope of an "if" or "switch".
    1903             :            This can happen in C++17 with constructs like:
    1904             :                  switch (int x = f(); int y = x+1) ...
    1905             :         */
    1906           0 :         early_sses_present = TRUE;
    1907           0 :         move_to_point = scope_stack_top().source_sequence_list;
    1908             :       }  /* if */
    1909         889 :     } else if (scope_stack_top().source_sequence_list != NULL) {
    1910             :       /* At the time we started disambiguation, the source sequence list for
    1911             :          this scope was empty, but now additional entries have been added.
    1912             :          Move the new entry to the head of the list. */
    1913           0 :       early_sses_present = TRUE;
    1914           0 :       move_to_point = scope_stack_top().source_sequence_list;
    1915             :     }  /* if */
    1916             :   }  /* if */
    1917        7752 :   f_update_source_sequence_list((char*)sp, (an_il_entry_kind)iek_statement,
    1918             :                                 (a_source_sequence_entry_ptr)NULL);
    1919        7752 :   if (early_sses_present) {
    1920             :     /* One or more source sequence entries were added as a side effect of
    1921             :        disambiguation before we added the entry for the statement above.
    1922             :        Move the entry for the statement to before those added entries. */
    1923           0 :     move_src_seq_entry(sp->source_sequence_entry, depth_scope_stack,
    1924             :                        move_to_point, depth_scope_stack);
    1925             :   }  /* if */
    1926        7752 : }  /* record_sse_for_decl_stmt */
    1927             : 
    1928             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    1929             : 
    1930             : 
    1931        7752 : static void decl_statement(a_boolean  marked_as_gnu_extension,
    1932             :                            a_boolean  *p_okay_in_constexpr_body)
    1933             : /*
    1934             : Parse a declaration statement.  An stmk_decl statement is created for the
    1935             : statement and the declared entities are recorded in it (except for entities
    1936             : declared in embedded scopes, like function prototype scopes or block scopes
    1937             : for GNU statement expressions).  If marked_as_gnu_extension is TRUE, the
    1938             : __extension__ keyword was scanned just before the upcoming declaration.
    1939             : If p_okay_in_constexpr_body is non-NULL, *p_okay_in_constexpr_body is set
    1940             : to TRUE if (and only if) the declaration that is parsed can be valid in the
    1941             : body of a constexpr function or constructor.
    1942             : */
    1943             : {
    1944        7752 :   a_decl_parse_state             dps;
    1945        7752 :   a_statement_ptr                sp;
    1946        7752 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr  sssep = &struct_stmt_stack_top();
    1947        7752 :   an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr    entity_list;
    1948             : 
    1949       14550 :   sp = add_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_decl);
    1950        7752 :   if (!sssep->record_declared_entities) {
    1951             :     /* The caller didn't set up a list to record declared entities.  Do it
    1952             :        now. */
    1953         765 :     sssep->record_declared_entities = TRUE;

    1955         765 :     sssep->p_declared_entities = &entity_list;
    1956             :   }  /* if */
    1957             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    1958        7752 :   if (!source_sequence_entries_disallowed) {
    1959        7752 :     record_sse_for_decl_statement(sp);
    1960             :   }  /* if */
    1961             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    1962        7752 :   init_decl_parse_state(&dps);
    1963        7752 :   dps.marked_as_gnu_extension = marked_as_gnu_extension;

    1965        7752 :   if (p_okay_in_constexpr_body != NULL) {
    1966        6798 :     if (!relaxed_constexpr_enabled) {
    1967           0 :       *p_okay_in_constexpr_body = dps.decl_okay_in_constexpr_body;
    1968             :     } else {
    1969        6798 :       a_boolean  decl_okay_in_constexpr_body = TRUE;
    1970             :       /* C++14 permits just about any declaration, except definitions of
    1971             :          variables with one or more of the following attributes:

    1988        7752 :   sssep = &struct_stmt_stack_top();
    1989             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    1990        7752 :   if (sssep->for_init && !source_sequence_entries_disallowed) {

    1993             :        follows in the source sequence list is an entry for a condition

    2007             : 
    2008             : 
    2009       20568 : static void start_potential_decl_statement(
    2010             :                                   an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr  *p_entity_list)
    2011             : /*
    2012             : A declaration vs. expression disambiguation is next and that may produce
    2013             : IL for declared entities.  E.g.:
    2014             : 
    2015             :     template<typename> struct X {};
    2016             :     int main() {
    2017             :       X<struct E> x;
    2018             :     }
    2019             : 
    2020             : The declaration of "struct E" in the argument list of X will trigger the
    2021             : creation of its associated source sequence entry, but the entry for the
    2022             : declaration statement for x is not yet on the list.  This routine records the
    2023             : needed information to be able to move the forthcoming source sequence entry for
    2024             : the statement to before the entries created during disambiguation.
    2025             : 
    2026             : Similarly, this routine also enables the recording of an_il_entity_list entries
    2027             : for any declared entities.  The list will be pointed to by *p_entity_list.
    2028             : *p_entity_list must be allocated in the caller's stack frame so it lasts until
    2029             : the end of the statement's processing.  In particular, it cannot be placed in
    2030             : the statement stack itself because it may also be referred to by other
    2031             : structures (e.g., a_decl_parse_state) and the statement stack could move during
    2032             : declaration processing.
    2033             : */
    2034             : {
    2035       20568 :   check_assertion(!C_mode());
    2036             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    2037             :   /* Record the current last entry in this scope so that any entries created
    2038             :      as part of disambiguation can be identified and moved later on. */
    2039       20568 :   struct_stmt_stack_top().last_sse_before_expr_decl_disambiguation =
    2040       20568 :                                 scope_stack_top().end_of_source_sequence_list;
    2041             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    2042             :   /* Start recording declared entities. */
    2043       20568 :   struct_stmt_stack_top().record_declared_entities = TRUE;
    2044       20568 :   struct_stmt_stack_top().p_declared_entities = p_entity_list;
    2045       20568 :   *p_entity_list = NULL;
    2046       20568 : }  /* start_potential_decl_statement */
    2047             : 
    2048             : 
    2049       20568 : static void end_potential_decl_statement(void)
    2050             : /*
    2051             : Undo any leftover state changes that resulted from calling
    2052             : start_potential_decl_statement and reclaim associated unused memory.
    2053             : */
    2054             : {
    2055             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    2056       20568 :   struct_stmt_stack_top().last_sse_before_expr_decl_disambiguation = NULL;
    2057             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    2058       20568 :   struct_stmt_stack_top().record_declared_entities = FALSE;
    2059       20568 :   struct_stmt_stack_top().p_declared_entities = NULL;
    2060       20568 : }  /* end_potential_decl_statement */

    2087     1190480 : void record_entity_in_decl_stmt_if_needed(a_symbol_ptr  sym)
    2088             : /*

    2091             : function or block scopes are recorded (in particular, entities declared in

    2132             : static a_statement_ptr create_vla_deallocation_stmt(a_variable_ptr  vla_var)
    2133             : /*
    2134             : Allocate and return a statement entry for the deallocation of a variable-length
    2135             : array (represented by the given variable entry).  This should only be called in

    2137             : may produce enk_vla_dealloc entries from those elsewhere).

    2156             : 
    2157             : 
    2158             : static a_statement_ptr collect_vla_dealloc_stmts(
    2159             :                                               a_control_flow_descr_ptr  start,
    2160             :                                               a_control_flow_descr_ptr  end)
    2161             : /*
    2162             : Create a list (possibly NULL) of vla-dealloc statements for each vla-decl
    2163             : statement in the current block that represents the declaration (and
    2164             : therefore allocation) of a VLA object.  The vla-decl statements are located
    2165             : by traversing the control-flow list backwards from *start to *end.
    2166             : */
    2167             : {
    2168             :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp, parent, end_parent, stop_at;
    2169             :   a_statement_ptr           dealloc_stmt, first = NULL, last = NULL;
    2170             :   a_boolean                 done;
    2171             : 
    2172             :   db_enter(4, "collect_vla_dealloc_stmts");
    2173             :   check_assertion(vla_deallocations_in_il);
    2174             : #if DEBUG
    2175             :   if (debug_level == 4) {
    2176             :     fputs("  start = ", f_debug);
    2177             :     db_cfd(start);
    2178             :     fputs("  end = ", f_debug);
    2179             :     if (end == NULL) {
    2180             :       fputs("NULL\n", f_debug);
    2181             :     } else {
    2182             :       db_cfd(end);
    2183             :     } /* if */
    2184             :   }  /* if */
    2185             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2186             :   cfdp = start;
    2187             :   parent = cfdp->parent;
    2188             :   if (end == NULL) {
    2189             :     end = control_flow_descr_list;
    2190             :     end_parent = NULL;
    2191             :   } else {
    2192             :     end_parent = end->parent;
    2193             :   }  /* if */
    2194             :   /* Step through control-flow entries from "start" to "end", which means
    2195             :      stepping backwards.  As an optimization, blocks that are marked as
    2196             :      having no VLA variable declarations are bypassed. */
    2197             :   done = (parent == NULL);
    2198             :   while (!done) {
    2199             :     check_assertion(parent != NULL);
    2200             :     if (!parent->variant.block.any_vla_variables) {
    2201             : #if DEBUG
    2202             :       if (debug_level == 4) {
    2203             :         fputs("  skipping block (no vla vars): ", f_debug);
    2204             :         db_cfd(parent);
    2205             :       }  /* if */
    2206             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2207             :       if (parent == end_parent) {
    2208             :         done = TRUE;
    2209             :       } else {
    2210             :         cfdp = parent;
    2211             :         if (parent == end) done = TRUE;
    2212             :         parent = parent->parent;
    2213             :       }  /* if */
    2214             :     } else {
    2215             :       if (parent == end_parent) {
    2216             :         stop_at = end;
    2217             :       } else {
    2218             :         stop_at = parent;
    2219             :       }  /* if */
    2220             : #if DEBUG
    2221             :       if (debug_level == 4) {
    2222             :         fputs("  inner loop: first entry = ", f_debug);
    2223             :         db_cfd(cfdp);
    2224             :         fputs("  stop_at = ", f_debug);
    2225             :         db_cfd(stop_at);
    2226             :       }  /* if */
    2227             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2228             :       /* Back up from *cfdp to *stop_at, looking for VLA variable
    2229             :          declarations. */
    2230             :       while (cfdp != stop_at) {
    2231             :         if (cfdp->kind == (a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_init) {
    2232             :           if (cfdp->variant.init.is_vla_variable) {
    2233             :             /* The declaration of a VLA variable has been located.  Create a
    2234             :                new statement to represent its deallocation. */
    2235             :             if (cfdp->variant.init.in_statement_expression) {
    2236             :               /* Variable-length arrays are not accepted in GNU statement
    2237             :                  expressions.  Since a deallocation statement may displace the
    2238             :                  actual "last statement", it could also trigger additional
    2239             :                  (spurious) errors about the type of the last statement.  So
    2240             :                  we don't create the deallocation node in such cases. */
    2241             :               check_assertion(total_errors != 0);
    2242             :             } else {
    2243             :               dealloc_stmt = create_vla_deallocation_stmt(
    2244             :                                                  cfdp->variant.init.variable);
    2245             :               /* Append it to the collected list. */
    2246             :               if (first == NULL) {
    2247             :                 first = last = dealloc_stmt;
    2248             :               } else {
    2249             :                 last->next = dealloc_stmt;
    2250             :                 last = last->next;
    2251             :               }  /* if */
    2252             :             }  /* if */
    2253             :           }  /* if */
    2254             :         } else if (cfdp->kind ==
    2255             :                           (a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_end_of_block) {
    2256             :           /* Skip a nested block. */
    2257             :           cfdp = cfdp->variant.start_of_block;
    2258             : #if DEBUG
    2259             :           if (debug_level == 4) {
    2260             :             fputs("  skipping nested block: ", f_debug);
    2261             :             db_cfd(cfdp);
    2262             :           }  /* if */
    2263             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2264             :         }  /* if */
    2265             :         cfdp = cfdp->prev;
    2266             : #if DEBUG
    2267             :         if (debug_level == 4) {
    2268             :           fputs("  inner loop: next entry = ", f_debug);
    2269             :           db_cfd(cfdp);
    2270             :         }  /* if */
    2271             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2272             :       }  /* while */
    2273             :       /* cpfe now points to the start of a block.  Keep stepping through
    2274             :          its parent block, if appropriate. */
    2275             :       if (cfdp == end) {
    2276             :         done = TRUE;
    2277             :       } else {
    2278             :         parent = cfdp->parent;
    2279             :       }  /* if */
    2280             :     }  /* if */
    2281             :   }  /* while */
    2282             :   db_exit();
    2283             :   return first;
    2284             : }  /* collect_vla_dealloc_stmts */
    2285             : 
    2286             : 
    2287             : static void add_vla_dealloc_stmts(a_control_flow_descr_ptr  start,
    2288             :                                   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  end,
    2289             :                                   a_boolean                 is_goto)
    2290             : /*
    2291             : Add a vla-dealloc statement to the statements list for each vla-decl
    2292             : statement in the current block that represents the declaration (and
    2293             : therefore allocation) of a VLA object.  The vla-decl statements are located
    2294             : by traversing the control-flow list backwards from *start to *end.  is_goto
    2295             : is TRUE if vla-dealloc statements are to be inserted in front of *start,
    2296             : which is a goto statement.  (It can be a goto statement even when is_goto
    2297             : is FALSE.)
    2298             : */
    2299             : {
    2300             :   a_statement_ptr           dealloc_stmts;
    2301             : 
    2302             :   db_enter(5, "add_vla_dealloc_stmts");
    2303             :   dealloc_stmts = collect_vla_dealloc_stmts(start, end);
    2304             : 
    2305             :   if (dealloc_stmts == NULL) {
    2306             :     /* Nothing to do. */
    2307             :   } else if (!is_goto) {
    2308             :     /* If the deallocation point is the end of a block or a return statement,
    2309             :        the deallocation statements are just added to the end of the statements
    2310             :        list. */
    2311             :     add_statement_list(dealloc_stmts, curr_reachability.reachable);
    2312             :   } else {
    2313             :     /* If the allocation point is a goto statement, the
    2314             :        deallocation statement needs to be inserted immediately
    2315             :        before the goto.  The trick is to turn the goto into a
    2316             :        block statement with a single statement in its list
    2317             :        (namely, the goto).  One or more vla-dealloc statements can
    2318             :        then be inserted before it -- local variable insert_point
    2319             :        is used to remember the point if multiple vla-decl
    2320             :        statements are found. */
    2321             :     a_statement_ptr  block_stmt, copy_of_goto_stmt;
    2322             :     /* Save the address of the goto statement in "block_stmt".
    2323             :        It will become a block statement with the call of
    2324             :        change_statement_into_block. */
    2325             :     block_stmt = start->variant.goto_statement.ptr;
    2326             :     change_statement_into_block(block_stmt, &copy_of_goto_stmt);
    2327             :     /* Reset the control flow entry pointing at the goto statement to use the
    2328             :        new pointer. */
    2329             :     start->variant.goto_statement.ptr = copy_of_goto_stmt;
    2330             :     /* Link the deallocation statement into the block. */
    2331             :     block_stmt->variant.block.statements = dealloc_stmts;
    2332             :     /* Find the end of the list of deallocation statements to link the copied
    2333             :        goto statement after it.  Also update the parent pointers. */
    2334             :     while (dealloc_stmts->next != NULL) {
    2335             :       dealloc_stmts->parent = block_stmt;
    2336             :       dealloc_stmts = dealloc_stmts->next;
    2337             :     }  /* while */
    2338             :     dealloc_stmts->parent = block_stmt;
    2339             :     dealloc_stmts->next = copy_of_goto_stmt;
    2340             :   }  /* if */
    2341             :   db_exit();
    2342             : }  /* add_vla_dealloc_stmts */
    2343             : 
    2344             : 
    2345             : static void add_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_block(a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp)
    2346             : /*
    2347             : Add vla-dealloc statements to the end of the statements list for declarations
    2348             : of VLA objects found within the current block, between *cfdp and the beginning
    2349             : of the block to which it belongs.  This routine is typically called when
    2350             : processing the normal end of a block.
    2351             : */
    2352             : {
    2353             :   check_assertion(end_of_control_flow_descr_list == cfdp);
    2354             :   if (cfdp->kind == (a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_block) {
    2355             :     /* Empty block: no need to look for VLA object initializations. */
    2356             :   } else {
    2357             :     add_vla_dealloc_stmts(cfdp, cfdp->parent, /*is_goto=*/FALSE);
    2358             :   }  /* if */
    2359             : }  /* add_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_block */
    2360             : 
    2361             : 
    2362             : static a_statement_ptr collect_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_function(
    2363             :                                                a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp)
    2364             : /*
    2365             : Add vla-dealloc statements for all declarations of VLA objects in currently
    2366             : active scopes.  The active scopes are located by starting with *cfdp and
    2367             : backing up through the control flow list (via the parent pointer) to the
    2368             : outermost scope of the function.  This function is typically called when
    2369             : processing a return statement (implicit or explicit).
    2370             : */
    2371             : {
    2372             :   check_assertion(end_of_control_flow_descr_list == cfdp);
    2373             :   return collect_vla_dealloc_stmts(cfdp, control_flow_descr_list);
    2374             : }  /* collect_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_function */
    2375             : 
    2376             : 
    2377             : static void add_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_goto(
    2378             :                                        a_control_flow_descr_ptr  goto_cfdp,
    2379             :                                        a_control_flow_descr_ptr  label_cfdp)
    2380             : /*
    2381             : Add vla-dealloc statements needed at a goto statement.  goto_cfdp describes
    2382             : the goto, and label_cfsp describes the associated label.
    2383             : */
    2384             : {
    2385             :   a_boolean                 forward_goto;
    2386             :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  common_parent, outermost_noncommon_parent;
    2387             :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  goto_parent, label_parent;
    2388             : 
    2389             :   db_enter(4, "add_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_goto");
    2390             : #if DEBUG
    2391             :   if (debug_level == 4) {
    2392             :     db_cfd(goto_cfdp);
    2393             :     db_cfd(label_cfdp);
    2394             :   }  /* if */
    2395             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2396             :   /* If the last entry on the control flow list is goto_cfdp, then the
    2397             :      label has already been defined and this is a backwards goto; otherwise
    2398             :      it's a forward goto. */
    2399             :   forward_goto = (goto_cfdp != end_of_control_flow_descr_list);
    2400             :   /* Find the common parent block (that is, the innermost block that
    2401             :      contains both the label and the goto), and the outermost noncommon
    2402             :      block, which is the block (if any) that is immediately within the
    2403             :      common parent block and that contains the label, if this is a backwards
    2404             :      goto, or the goto, if this is a forward goto.  The rationale is
    2405             :      provided below. */
    2406             :   common_parent = NULL;
    2407             :   outermost_noncommon_parent = NULL;
    2408             :   /* Step from inner scope to outer, starting with the block of the goto. */
    2409             :   for (goto_parent = goto_cfdp->parent;
    2410             :        goto_parent != NULL;
    2411             :        goto_parent = goto_parent->parent) {
    2412             :     /* Step from inner scope to outer, starting with the block of the label.
    2413             :        If this is a backwards goto, the outermost noncommon parent is reset
    2414             :        each time the inner loop is entered. */
    2415             :     if (!forward_goto) outermost_noncommon_parent = NULL;
    2416             :     for (label_parent = label_cfdp->parent;
    2417             :          label_parent != NULL;
    2418             :          label_parent = label_parent->parent) {
    2419             :       /* The first block that is common to both loops is the common parent. */
    2420             :       if (goto_parent == label_parent) {
    2421             :         common_parent = goto_parent;
    2422             :         break;
    2423             :       }  /* if */
    2424             :       if (!forward_goto) outermost_noncommon_parent = label_parent;
    2425             :     }  /* for */
    2426             :     if (common_parent != NULL) break;
    2427             :     if (forward_goto) outermost_noncommon_parent = goto_parent;
    2428             :   }  /* for */
    2429             : #if DEBUG
    2430             :   if (debug_level == 4) {
    2431             :     fputs("common_parent = ", f_debug);
    2432             :     if (common_parent == NULL) {
    2433             :       fputs("NULL\n", f_debug);
    2434             :     } else {
    2435             :       db_cfd(common_parent);
    2436             :     } /* if */
    2437             :     fputs("outermost_noncommon_parent = ", f_debug);
    2438             :     if (outermost_noncommon_parent == NULL) {
    2439             :       fputs("NULL\n", f_debug);
    2440             :     } else {
    2441             :       db_cfd(outermost_noncommon_parent);
    2442             :     } /* if */
    2443             :   }  /* if */
    2444             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2445             :   /* There are 2 orthogonal sets of criteria for determining how to search
    2446             :      for VLAs that need to be deallocated.  There is the direction of the
    2447             :      goto (forward or backwards) and the nesting relationship: (1) the goto
    2448             :      and label are in the same scope; (2) the scope of the goto is nested
    2449             :      within the scope of the label; (3) the scope of the label is nested
    2450             :      within the scope of the goto; and (4) neither scope includes the
    2451             :      other.  The 8 situations can be pictured as follows:
    2452             : 
    2453             :        forward:
    2454             :          (1)          (2)           (3)          (4)
    2455             :               |           |             |            |
    2456             :               |           ----          |            ----
    2457             :              goto            |*        goto             |*
    2458             :               |             goto        |              goto
    2459             :               |              |          ----            |
    2460             :               |           ----             |         ----
    2461             :             label         |              label       |
    2462             :                         label                        ----
    2463             :                                                         |
    2464             :                                                       label
    2465             :        backwards:
    2466             :          (1)          (2)           (3)          (4)
    2467             :               |           |             |            |
    2468             :               |           |             ----         ----
    2469             :             label       label              |            |
    2470             :               |*          |*             label        label
    2471             :               |*          ----             |            |
    2472             :               |*             |*         ----         ----
    2473             :              goto          goto         |*           |*
    2474             :                                        goto          ----
    2475             :                                                         |*
    2476             :                                                        goto
    2477             : 
    2478             :      The sections marked "|*" are searched for VLA declarations for which
    2479             :      deallocation statements are inserted immediately before the goto. */
    2480             :   if (forward_goto) {
    2481             :     if (goto_cfdp->parent == common_parent) {
    2482             :       /* Forward (1) and (3): no action required. */
    2483             :     } else {
    2484             :       /* Forward (2) and (4): back up from the goto to the beginning of the
    2485             :          outermost noncommon parent. */
    2486             :       check_assertion(outermost_noncommon_parent != NULL &&
    2487             :                       outermost_noncommon_parent->parent == common_parent);
    2488             :       add_vla_dealloc_stmts(goto_cfdp, outermost_noncommon_parent,
    2489             :                             /*is_goto=*/TRUE);
    2490             :     }  /* if */
    2491             :   } else {
    2492             :     if (label_cfdp->parent == common_parent) {
    2493             :       /* Backwards (1) and (2): back up from the goto to the label. */
    2494             :       add_vla_dealloc_stmts(goto_cfdp, label_cfdp, /*is_goto=*/TRUE);
    2495             :     } else {
    2496             :       /* Backwards (3) and (4): back up from the goto to the end of the
    2497             :          outermost noncommon parent. */
    2498             :       check_assertion(outermost_noncommon_parent != NULL &&
    2499             :                       outermost_noncommon_parent->parent == common_parent);
    2500             :       check_assertion(outermost_noncommon_parent->
    2501             :                                   variant.block.end_of_block != NULL);
    2502             :       add_vla_dealloc_stmts(goto_cfdp,
    2503             :                             outermost_noncommon_parent->
    2504             :                               variant.block.end_of_block,
    2505             :                             /*is_goto=*/TRUE);
    2506             :     }  /* if */
    2507             :   }  /* if */
    2508             :   db_exit();
    2509             : }  /* add_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_goto */
    2510             : 
    2511             : #endif /* VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL */
    2512             : 
    2513          12 : void set_vla_size_statement(a_vla_dimension_ptr  vdp,
    2514             :                             a_source_position    *pos)
    2515             : /*
    2516             : Generate an stmk_set_vla_size statement for a variable length array
    2517             : (represented by vdp) to indicate when (at runtime) the VLA dimension
    2518             : expression is to be evaluated to fix the size of the array.
    2519             : */
    2520             : {
    2521          12 :   a_statement_ptr          vla_stmt;
    2522             : 
    2523          12 :   vla_stmt = add_statement_at_stmt_pos((a_statement_kind)stmk_set_vla_size,
    2524             :                                        pos);
    2525          12 :   vla_stmt->variant.vla_dimension = vdp;
    2526          12 :   update_init_statement_control_flow(vla_stmt);
    2527          12 : }  /* set_vla_size_statement */
    2528             : 
    2529             : 
    2530       41015 : void warn_if_code_is_unreachable(an_error_code      error_code,
    2531             :                                  a_source_position  *err_pos)
    2532             : /*
    2533             : If the current location in the code is unreachable, generate a warning,
    2534             : using the specified diagnostic message at the specified source position.
    2535             : */
    2536             : {
    2537       41015 :   if (!curr_reachability.reachable) {
    2538           1 :     if (!curr_reachability.suppress_unreachable_warning) {
    2539           1 :       pos_warning(error_code, err_pos);
    2540             :       /* Suppress the warning once it has been issued. */
    2541           1 :       curr_reachability.suppress_unreachable_warning = TRUE;
    2542             :     }  /* if */
    2543             :   }  /* if */
    2544       41015 : }  /* warn_if_code_is_unreachable */

    2551             : #define check_for_unreachable_code()                                    \
    2552             :   warn_if_code_is_unreachable(ec_code_is_unreachable, &error_position)
    2553             :

    2555          16 : static a_label_ptr alloc_temp_label(void)

    2569         139 : static void define_label(a_label_ptr label)
    2570             : /*
    2571             : Put out the definition for the indicated label.  If label == NULL, do nothing.
    2572             : */
    2573             : {
    2574         139 :   a_statement_ptr sp;
    2575             : 
    2576         139 :   db_enter(4, "define_label");

    2590             : 
    2591             : 
    2592         259 : static an_object_lifetime_ptr common_object_lifetime(
    2593             :                                               an_object_lifetime_ptr  olp1,
    2594             :                                               an_object_lifetime_ptr  olp2)
    2595             : /*
    2596             : Return the innermost olk_block or olk_block_after_label lifetime that is
    2597             : common to the parent lists of olp1 and olp2.  It is assumed that olp1 and
    2598             : olp2 appear in the same function context and therefore that the current
    2599             : function scope object lifetime, at least, appears on both ancestries.  This
    2600             : function should only be called in C++ mode.
    2601             : */
    2602             : {
    2603         259 :   an_object_lifetime_ptr  olp;
    2604             : 
    2605         259 :   db_enter(4, "common_object_lifetime");
    2606         259 :   if (olp1 != olp2) {
    2607             : #if DEBUG
    2608           1 :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
    2609           0 :       db_object_lifetime_stack();
    2610           0 :       fputs("olp1 = ", f_debug);
    2611           0 :       db_object_lifetime(olp1);
    2612           0 :       fputs("olp2 = ", f_debug);
    2613           0 :       db_object_lifetime(olp2);
    2614             :     }  /* if */
    2615             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2616             :     /* The outer loop follows olp2 and its parent lifetimes. */
    2617           4 :     for (; olp2 != function_scope_object_lifetime;
    2618           3 :            olp2 = innermost_block_object_lifetime(olp2->parent_lifetime)) {
    2619             :       /* The inner loop follows olp1 and its parent lifetimes. */
    2620           7 :       for (olp = olp1;
    2621           7 :            olp != function_scope_object_lifetime;
    2622           3 :            olp = innermost_block_object_lifetime(olp->parent_lifetime)) {
    2623           4 :         if (olp == olp2) {
    2624             :           /* Found a match. */
    2625             : #if DEBUG
    2626           1 :           if (debug_level >= 4) {
    2627           0 :             fputs("common = ", f_debug);
    2628           0 :             db_object_lifetime(olp2);
    2629             :           }  /* if */
    2630             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2631           1 :           goto done;
    2632             :         }  /* if */
    2633             :       }  /* for */
    2634             :     }  /* for */
    2635             :   }  /* if */
    2636         258 : done:
    2637             : 
    2638         259 :   db_exit();
    2639         259 :   return olp2;
    2640             : }  /* common_object_lifetime */
    2641             : 
    2642             : 
    2643         137 : static void define_implicit_label(a_label_ptr               label,
    2644             :                                   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  goto_cfdp)
    2645             : /*
    2646             : Define the specified label, which will have been referenced by one or more
    2647             : goto statements represented by the linked list of control flow entries
    2648             : headed by goto_cfdp.
    2649             : */
    2650             : {
    2651         137 :   an_object_lifetime_ptr    label_olp, *goto_olp_addr;
    2652         137 :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp = NULL;
    2653             : 
    2654         137 :   define_label(label);
    2655         137 :   if (!C_mode() || vla_enabled) {
    2656             :     /* Do special C++ processing -- it's not needed in C mode because it is
    2657             :        only used to support object lifetimes.  It is needed in C for
    2658             :        variable-length arrays, however. */
    2659             :     /* Create a control-flow entry to represent this label. */
    2660         137 :     cfdp = alloc_control_flow_descr((a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_label);
    2661         137 :     cfdp->variant.label_statement = label->exec_stmt;
    2662         137 :     cfdp->source_pos = pos_curr_token;
