    2706         287 : static void expand_struct_stmt_stack(void)
    2707             : /*
    2708             : Reallocate the structured statement stack container, copying the contents
    2709             : of the present one into the new one.  Also reset static variables defining
    2710             : the size and state of the stack:  size_struct_stmt_stack_container,
    2711             : struct_stmt_stack_container, and struct_stmt_stack.
    2712             : */
    2713             : {
    2714         287 :   sizeof_t  struct_stmt_stack_offset, new_size;
    2715             : 
    2716             :   /* Note that struct_stmt_stack is a pointer into the container.  This
    2717             :      allows several stacks to coexist, though only that pointed to by
    2718             :      struct_stmt_stack is currently active.  The offset computed is the
    2719             :      element count from the start of the container to the start of the
    2720             :      currently active stack. */
    2721         287 :   struct_stmt_stack_offset = struct_stmt_stack - struct_stmt_stack_container;
    2722             :   /* Recompute the size of the container. */
    2723         287 :   new_size = size_struct_stmt_stack_container +
    2724             :                                       STRUCT_STMT_STACK_INCREMENTAL_ALLOCATION;
    2725             :   /* Reallocate the container, copying the old to the new. */
    2726         574 :   struct_stmt_stack_container =
    2727         287 :                        (a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr)realloc_buffer(
    2728             :                        (char *)struct_stmt_stack_container,
    2729             :                        (sizeof_t)(size_struct_stmt_stack_container*
    2730             :                                             sizeof(a_struct_stmt_stack_entry)),
    2731             :                        (sizeof_t)(new_size*sizeof(a_struct_stmt_stack_entry)));
    2732             :   /* Record the size of the container. */
    2733         287 :   size_struct_stmt_stack_container = new_size;
    2734             :   /* Recompute the address of the struct_stmt_stack.  The offset remains the
    2735             :      the same, but the address of the container has changed. */
    2736         287 :   struct_stmt_stack = struct_stmt_stack_container + struct_stmt_stack_offset;
    2737         287 : }  /* expand_struct_stmt_stack */
    2738             : 
    2739             : 
    2740             : /* Macro to check whether the structured statement stack is large enough to
    2741             :    accept one more entry and if it is not to reallocate it to a larger size. */
    2742             : #define ensure_struct_stmt_stack_space()                                \
    2743             :   if ((sizeof_t)(struct_stmt_stack -                                    \
    2744             :                  struct_stmt_stack_container +                          \
    2745             :                  depth_stmt_stack + 1) ==                               \
    2746             :                                           size_struct_stmt_stack_container) { \
    2747             :     expand_struct_stmt_stack();                                   \
    2748             :   }  /* if */
    2749             : 
    2750             : 
    2751       14949 : void new_struct_stmt_stack(a_struct_stmt_stack_state *saved_state)
    2752             : /*
    2753             : Save the state of the current structured statement stack, returning it to
    2754             : the caller, and create a new structured statement stack.  This is used to
    2755             : support function definitions nested within function definitions -- a
    2756             : possibility in C++ with member functions of local classes.  There is no
    2757             : algorithmic limit on the number of levels of nesting supported.
    2758             : */
    2759             : {
    2760             :   /* Expand the structured statement stack if necessary. */
    2761       14949 :   ensure_struct_stmt_stack_space();
    2762       14949 :   saved_state->container_pos = struct_stmt_stack - struct_stmt_stack_container;
    2763       14949 :   saved_state->depth_stmt_stack = depth_stmt_stack;
    2764       14949 :   struct_stmt_stack = &struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack+1];
    2765       14949 :   depth_stmt_stack = -1;
    2766       14949 :   saved_state->code_reachability = curr_reachability;
    2767       14949 :   saved_state->control_flow_list = control_flow_descr_list;
    2768       14949 :   saved_state->end_of_control_flow_list = end_of_control_flow_descr_list;
    2769       14949 : }  /* new_struct_stmt_stack */
    2770             : 
    2771             : 
    2772       14949 : void restore_struct_stmt_stack(a_struct_stmt_stack_state *saved_state)

    2798       36297 : static void push_stmt_stack_full(a_struct_stmt_kind      kind,

    2981       39763 : static void end_stmt_sequence(a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep)

    2993        2508 : static void start_stmt_clause(a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep)
    2994             : /*
    2995             : Start a new clause of a structured statement.  sssep points to the
    2996             : struct_stmt_stack entry for the structured statement (since it need not
    2997             : be the topmost one).  A call of this routine implies that the current
    2998             : position in the program can be branched to from the statement that
    2999             : begins the indicated structured statement.
    3000             : */
    3001             : {
    3002             :   /* The start of a clause is reachable if the start of the structured
    3003             :      statement is reachable. */
    3004        2508 :   curr_reachability = sssep->start_reachable;
    3005             : }  /* start_stmt_clause */
    3006             : 
    3007             : 
    3008       38805 : static void term_stmt_clause(a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep)
    3009             : /*
    3010             : end the current clause of a structured statement.  sssep points to the
    3011             : struct_stmt_stack entry for the structured statement.  A call of this
    3012             : routine implies that the current position in the program branches
    3013             : to the end of the indicated structured statement.
    3014             : */
    3015             : {
    3016             :   /* If the end of the clause is reachable, then the end of the whole
    3017             :      structured statement is reachable. */
    3018       38805 :   merge_reachability(&curr_reachability, &sssep->end_reachable);
    3019       38805 :   end_stmt_sequence(sssep);
    3020             : }  /* term_stmt_clause */

    3023        5020 : static a_boolean is_true_constant_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    3024             : /*
    3025             : Return TRUE if the indicated expression has a constant value that is true.
    3026             : The safe answer, if the truth cannot be discovered, is FALSE.
    3027             : */
    3028             : {
    3029        5020 :   a_boolean is_true_constant;
    3030             : 
    3031        5020 :   expr = skip_parens(expr);
    3032        5020 :   if (is_operation_node(expr) && node_operator_is(expr, eok_bool_cast)) {
    3033        2046 :     expr = skip_parens(expr->variant.operation.operands);
    3034             :   }  /* if */
    3035        5020 :   while (is_operation_node(expr) && node_operator_is(expr, eok_comma)) {
    3036           0 :     expr = skip_parens(expr->variant.operation.operands->next);
    3037             :   }  /* while */
    3038         703 :   is_true_constant = (is_constant_node(expr) &&
    3039         703 :                       constant_bool_value_known_at_compile_time(
    3040        5036 :                                                        node_constant(expr)) &&
    3041          16 :                       !is_false_constant(node_constant(expr)));

    3044             : 
    3045             : 
    3046             : static a_boolean is_infinite_loop(a_statement_ptr stmt)
    3047             : /*
    3048             : Return TRUE if the indicated statement is an infinite loop.  The safe answer,
    3049             : if the truth cannot be discovered, is FALSE.
    3050             : */
    3051             : {
    3052             :   a_boolean        is_inf_loop = FALSE;
    3053             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr;
    3054             : 
    3055             :   /* The test for an enhanced-for (i.e., a for-each or range-based-for) loop
    3056             :      varies depending on the type of enhanced-for loop that has been detected.
    3057             :      For array iteration, we're assured that the loop is finite; for other
    3058             :      types various expressions could be examined, but the expressions all
    3059             :      involve calls of some sort and since they haven't been inlined yet, this
    3060             :      code is too simplistic to determine whether the call would always return
    3061             :      true.  Therefore, assume enhanced-for loops are never infinite. */
    3062             :   if (stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_while ||
    3063             :       stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_end_test_while ||
    3064             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3065             :       stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_upc_forall ||
    3066             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    3067             :       stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_for) {
    3068             :     expr = stmt->expr;
    3069             :     /* In the "for" loop, the expression can be NULL and that implies an
    3070             :        infinite loop. */
    3071             :     if (expr == NULL) {
    3072             :       is_inf_loop = TRUE;
    3073             :     } else if (is_true_constant_expr(expr)) {
    3074             :       /* Loop expression is a non-zero constant: it's an infinite loop. */
    3075             :       is_inf_loop = TRUE;
    3076             :     }  /* if */
    3077             :   } /* if */
    3078             :   return(is_inf_loop);
    3079             : }  /* is_infinite_loop */
    3080             : 
    3081             : 
    3082             : static void terminate_curr_block_object_lifetime(
    3083             :                                       a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr  sssep)
    3084             : /*
    3085             : sssep represents a compound statement that either has completed or has an
    3086             : invalidated object lifetime because of the appearance of a label statement.
    3087             : Do final processing on the object lifetime -- that is, if it is going to be
    3088             : retained in the IL, bind it to an IL entity.
    3089             : */
    3090             : {
    3091             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr  olp;
    3092             : 
    3093             :   /* Set olp to point to the object lifetime that is currently active for
    3094             :      the block associated with *sssep. */
    3095             :   olp = sssep->curr_block_object_lifetime;
    3096             :   if (olp != NULL && olp->kind == (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block &&
    3097             :       olp->entity.ptr == NULL && !is_useless_object_lifetime(olp)) {
    3098             :     /* olp is still unbound but it has a destructions list.  It will be
    3099             :        retained in the IL, so it needs to be bound to an IL entry -- either a
    3100             :        scope or a block. */
    3101             : #if CHECKING
    3102             :     a_statement_ptr  sp = sssep->statement;
    3103             : 
    3104             :     check_assertion_str2(olp == curr_object_lifetime,
    3105             :                          "terminate_curr_block_object_lifetime:",
    3106             :                          "not at top of lifetime stack");
    3107             :     check_assertion_str2(sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block,
    3108             :                          "terminate_curr_block_object_lifetime:",
    3109             :                          "expected a block statement");
    3110             :     check_assertion_str2(!block_stmt_is_cfront_dependent_stmt(sp),
    3111             :                          "terminate_curr_block_object_lifetime:",
    3112             :                          "cfront dependent statement not expected");
    3113             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    3114             :     /* There is a scope associated with this block; bind the lifetime
    3115             :        directly to it. */
    3116             :     (void)ensure_il_scope_exists(&scope_stack[depth_scope_stack]);
    3117             :     check_assertion_str2(olp->entity.ptr != NULL,
    3118             :                          "terminate_curr_block_object_lifetime:",
    3119             :                          "scope stack out of sync with struct stmt stack");
    3120             :   }  /* if */
    3121             : }  /* terminate_curr_block_object_lifetime */
    3122             : 
    3123             : 
    3124       17567 : static void reset_curr_block_object_lifetime(a_statement_ptr sp)
    3125             : /*
    3126             : If the current structured statement stack entry represents a compound
    3127             : statement in which a label has appeared that "invalidates" the object
    3128             : lifetime of the current block, do final processing on the invalidated object
    3129             : lifetime and create a new one (of kind olk_block_after_label) to run for the
    3130             : rest of this compound statement.  This handles cases in which the label
    3131             : appears in the same block or in a nested block.  For example:
    3132             : 
    3133             :     {                           // start of outer block
    3134             :       <olk_block>
    3135             :       {                         // start of inner block
    3136             :         <olk_block>
    3137             :     L:                          // "invalidates" both olk_block lifetimes
    3138             :         <olk_block_after_label>
    3139             :       }                         // resume outer block
    3140             :       <olk_block_after_label>
    3141             :     }
    3142             : 
    3143             : This routine is called both at label statements and immediately after a
    3144             : structured statement terminates (i.e., in the context of the block just
    3145             : resumed).  sp indicates the statement that starts the new object lifetime
    3146             : (e.g., an stmk_label statement).
    3147             : */
    3148             : {
    3149       17567 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr  sssep = &struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack];
    3150             :   
    3151       17567 :   if (sssep->kind == (a_struct_stmt_kind)ssk_compound &&
    3152             :       sssep->label_invalidates_curr_block_object_lifetime) {
    3153             :     /* Do any final processing required before eclipsing the previously
    3154             :        active object lifetime with a new one. */
    3155           2 :     terminate_curr_block_object_lifetime(sssep);
    3156             :     /* Push the object lifetime and set the struct-stmt-stack entry to point
    3157             :        to it. */
    3158           2 :     push_object_lifetime((an_il_entry_kind)iek_statement, (char *)sp,
    3159             :                          (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block_after_label);
    3160           2 :     sssep->curr_block_object_lifetime = curr_object_lifetime;
    3161           2 :     sssep->label_invalidates_curr_block_object_lifetime = FALSE;
    3162             :   }  /* if */
    3163       17567 : }  /* reset_curr_block_object_lifetime */
    3164             : 
    3165             : 
    3166       36297 : static void pop_stmt_stack(void)
    3167             : /*
    3168             : Pop the top entry off the structured statement stack, recording that
    3169             : a structured statement has ended.
    3170             : */
    3171             : {
    3172       36297 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr          sssep;
    3173       36297 :   a_struct_stmt_kind                     kind;
    3174       36297 :   a_statement_ptr                        sp;
    3175       36297 :   a_label_ptr                            break_label;
    3176       36297 :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr               break_statements;
    3177             :   
    3178       36297 :   db_enter(4, "pop_stmt_stack");
    3179       36297 :   sssep = &struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack];
    3180       36297 :   kind = sssep->kind;
    3181       36297 :   sp = sssep->statement;
    3182             :   /* Close the final clause of the statement. */
    3183       36297 :   term_stmt_clause(sssep);
    3184             :   /* Determine whether or not the code following the statement is reachable,
    3185             :      and set curr_reachability appropriately. */
    3186       36297 :   if (kind == ssk_while || kind == ssk_for || kind == ssk_do ||
    3187             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3188             :       kind == ssk_for_each ||
    3189             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    3190       34925 :       kind == ssk_range_based_for) {
    3191             :     /* A loop. */
    3192        1429 :     if (is_infinite_loop(sp)) {
    3193             :       /* An infinite loop.  The code after the loop is not reachable. */
    3194          32 :       set_unreachable(curr_reachability);
    3195        1397 :     } else if (kind == ssk_while || kind == ssk_for ||
    3196             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3197             :                kind == ssk_for_each ||
    3198             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    3199             :                kind == ssk_range_based_for) {
    3200             :       /* A top-test loop.  The code after the loop is reachable if the current
    3201             :          location is reachable or if the start of the loop is reachable. */
    3202        1340 :       merge_reachability(&sssep->start_reachable, &curr_reachability);
    3203             :     } else {
    3204             :       /* A bottom-test loop.  The code after the loop is reachable if the
    3205             :          current location is reachable. */
    3206             :     }  /* if */
    3207             :   } else {
    3208             :     /* Non-loop statement. */
    3209       34868 :     if (kind == ssk_switch) {
    3210           1 :       if (sssep->statement->variant.switch_stmt.extra_info->default_case
    3211             :                                                                     == NULL) {
    3212             :         /* Switch statement without a default.  If the initial statement
    3213             :            can be reached, the end can be reached. */
    3214           0 :         merge_reachability(&sssep->start_reachable, &sssep->end_reachable);
    3215             :       } else {
    3216             :         /* Switch statement with a default.  If the end of the default clause
    3217             :            is reachable (curr_reachability), then the end of the switch can
    3218             :            be reached. */
    3219           1 :         merge_reachability(&curr_reachability, &sssep->end_reachable);
    3220             :       }  /* if */
    3221           1 :       if (sssep->fallthrough_statement != NULL) {
    3222             :         /* A fallthrough statement was the last item in the switch. */

    3224             :                                     strict_ansi_discretionary_severity,
    3225             :                        ec_fallthrough_must_precede_switch_case,
    3226             :                        &sssep->fallthrough_statement->position);
    3227             :       }  /* if */
    3228       38474 :     } else if (kind == ssk_if && sp->variant.if_stmt.else_statement == NULL &&

    3230             :       /* If without an else, except "if (1) ...".  If the initial statement
    3231             :          can be reached, the end can be reached. */
    3232        3607 :       merge_reachability(&sssep->start_reachable, &sssep->end_reachable);
    3233       31260 :     } else if (kind == ssk_constexpr_if &&
    3234           0 :                sp->variant.constexpr_if->else_statement == NULL &&
    3235           0 :                !is_true_constant_expr(sp->expr)) {
    3236             :       /* If without an else, except "if (1) ...".  If the initial statement
    3237             :          can be reached, the end can be reached. */
    3238           0 :       merge_reachability(&sssep->start_reachable, &sssep->end_reachable);
    3239             :     }  /* if */
    3240             :     /* The code after the statement can be reached if the end of the statement
    3241             :        can be reached. */
    3242       34868 :     curr_reachability = sssep->end_reachable;
    3243             :   }  /* if */
    3244       36297 :   if (depth_stmt_stack > 0) {
    3245             :     /* If the statement just exited is a non-block, propagate the

    3345         260 : static a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr find_enclosing_struct_stmt(
    3346             :                                                      a_boolean find_switch,
    3347             :                                                      a_boolean find_loop)
    3348             : /*
    3349             : Search the structured statement stack from the current entry outward,
    3350             : looking for a switch statement (if find_switch is TRUE) or a loop
    3351             : statement (while, do, or for; if find_loop is TRUE).  Return a pointer
    3352             : to the first structured statement stack entry found, or NULL if none 
    3353             : was found.

    3356         260 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep;

    3359         260 :   sssep = &struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack];

    3361             :      the compound statement that defines the function. */

    3367        1650 :                (kind == ssk_while || kind == ssk_do || kind == ssk_for ||
    3368             :                 kind == ssk_range_based_for
    3369             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3370             :                 || kind == ssk_for_each

    3372             :               )) {
    3373         256 :       goto found;
    3374             :     }  /* if */
    3375             :     /* Keeping looking at entries in the structured statement stack. */
    3376        1396 :     sssep--;

    3396       10079 : static a_statement_ptr start_block_statement(
    3397             :                                   a_boolean              generated_statement,
    3398             :                                   a_boolean              is_statement_expr,
    3399             :                                   an_object_lifetime_ptr function_try_lifetime)
    3400             : /*
    3401             : Do processing to begin a block or compound statement.  Return a pointer
    3402             : to the block statement.  generated_statement is TRUE if the block is
    3403             : generated, e.g., to surround a dependent statement in C++ or C99.
    3404             : is_statement_expr is TRUE if the statement is the top of a GNU
    3405             : statement expression, ({ ... }).  If function_try_lifetime is
    3406             : non-NULL, it points to an object lifetime preallocated for the
    3407             : block under the "try" in a function try block.
    3408             : */

    3410       10079 :   a_struct_stmt_kind      kind;

    3416             :        the current statement on the statement stack. */

    3483             : 
    3484       10881 : static void finish_block_statement(a_statement_ptr block_stmt)
    3485             : /*
    3486             : Do processing to finish a block or compound statement.  block_stmt points to
    3487             : the block statement.
    3488             : */
    3489             : {
    3490       10881 :   a_block_ptr block = block_stmt->variant.block.extra_info;
    3491       10881 :   a_boolean   is_statement_expression = FALSE;
    3492             : 
    3493             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3494       10881 :   is_statement_expression = block->is_statement_expression;
    3495             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    3496             :   /* Remember whether or not the end of the block is reachable.  This
    3497             :      is helpful in IL lowering. */
    3498       10881 :   block->end_of_block_reachable = curr_reachability.reachable;
    3499             : #if VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL
    3500             :   if (vla_enabled && vla_deallocations_in_il &&
    3501             :       curr_reachability.reachable) {
    3502             :     /* Put out a vla-dealloc statement for each declaration of a VLA variable
    3503             :        in the current block. */
    3504             :     add_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_block(end_of_control_flow_descr_list);
    3505             :   }  /* if */
    3506             : #endif /* VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL */
    3507             :   /* Pop the statement stack. */
    3508       10881 :   pop_stmt_stack();

    3510             :     /* cfront mode dependent statement. */
    3511           0 :     (void)pop_object_lifetime();

    3513             :     /* Store the IL scope pointer in the block.  This is usually NULL for
    3514             :        blocks with no declarations. */

    3518          59 :         ssep->curr_scope_object_lifetime != NULL &&

    3545        8449 : static void dependent_statement(void)
    3546             : /*
    3547             : Scan the dependent statement of an if, switch, while, do-while, for,
    3548             : "for each", or range-based-for statement.  In C++ and C99, such a dependent
    3549             : statement implicitly defines a local scope.

    3559             :     block_added = FALSE;

    3582             : 
    3583             : 
    3584        7019 : static void dependent_statement_of_if(a_boolean is_if)
    3585             : /*
    3586             : Scan the dependent statement of an if, which could be a constexpr if.
    3587             : For the constexpr case, if the dependent statement is to be considered
    3588             : discarded:
    3589             :   - In the non-template case, it is scanned with some special processing
    3590             :     (for example, not treating some references as ODR uses).
    3591             :   - In the template case, the tokens of the dependent statement are
    3592             :     discarded.
    3593             : 
    3594             : In a template function, if a prototype instantiation was done, information
    3595             : saved during the prototype instantiation is used to skip over the discarded
    3596             : branch of the if, and this routine is not called for the discarded
    3597             : branch.  If nonclass prototype instantiations are not being done, then this
    3598             : routine is called to flush the tokens of the discarded branch.
    3599             : 
    3600             : is_if is TRUE if this is the dependent statement of an "if" or FALSE if it
    3601             : is for an "else".
    3602             : */
    3603             : {
    3604        7019 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep;
    3605             : 
    3606        7019 :   sssep = &struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack];
    3607             :   /* In a template instantiation, skip the tokens if the statement is
    3608             :      to be discarded, otherwise process it normally. */
    3609        7019 :   if (is_real_instantiation_context() && sssep->in_discarded_statement) {
    3610           0 :     flush_if_or_else_statement(is_if);
    3611           0 :     empty_statement();
    3612             :   } else {
    3613        7019 :     dependent_statement();
    3614             :   }  /* if */
    3615        7019 : }  /* dependent_statement_of_if */
    3616             : 
    3617             : 
    3618          56 : static void record_condition_initializations(an_il_entity_list_entry  *entry,
    3619             :                                              a_statement_ptr          sp)
    3620             : /*

    3622             : given statement, which is associated with a declaration in a condition (see
    3623             : scan_structured_control_value).  For each of those entities that is a variable
    3624             : with a dynamic initialization, record a cfdk_init control flow description that
    3625             : records that initialization (so attempts to jump over them will elicit an
    3626             : error).
    3627             : */

    3645             : 
    3646          56 : static void scan_structured_control_value(a_statement_ptr    sp,
    3647             :                                           an_init_component  *cached_expr)
    3648             : /*
    3649             : Scan a C++ control value (a boolean control value or a switch value) for the
    3650             : given statement that is more than just an expression.  In C++, the following
    3651             : additional forms are possible (shown with "if" for simplicity):
    3652             : 
    3653             :     if (<declaration>) ...
    3654             :     if (<declaration>; <expression>) ... 
    3655             :     if (<expression>; <declaration>) ... 
    3656             :     if (<expression>; <expression>) ... 
    3657             : 
    3658             : The latter three forms are a C++17 feature (enabled when the global variable
    3659             : selection_initializers_enabled is TRUE) that only applies to "if" and "switch"
    3660             : statements.  For the latter two forms, the first expression has already been
    3661             : scanned into *cached_expr.
    3662             : 
    3663             : Scan the remainder of the construct.  This includes creating an sck_condition
    3664             : scope and an enk_condition node (the node is attached to sp).
    3665             : */
    3666             : {
    3667          56 :   an_expr_node_ptr               node, value_expr;
    3668          56 :   a_variable_ptr                 vp;
    3669          56 :   a_scope_ptr                    scope;

    3671          56 :   a_boolean                      is_switch_expr =
    3672          56 :                                   (sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_switch);

    3674          56 :   a_decl_parse_state             dps;
    3675          56 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr  sssep = &struct_stmt_stack_top();
    3676          56 :   an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr    entity_list;
    3677             : 
    3678             :   /* Push the new scope, and bind the if, switch, for, or while statement to
    3679             :      it. */
    3680          56 :   scope = push_scope((a_scope_kind)sck_condition, NO_SCOPE_NUMBER,
    3681             :                      (a_type_ptr)NULL, (a_routine_ptr)NULL);
    3682          56 :   scope->variant.assoc_statement = sp;
    3683             :   /* Add a control flow entry to represent the condition block. */
    3684          56 :   cfdp = alloc_control_flow_descr((a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_block);
    3685          56 :   cfdp->source_pos = pos_curr_token;
    3686          56 :   cfdp->variant.block.object_lifetime = curr_object_lifetime;
    3687          56 :   add_to_control_flow_descr_list(cfdp);
    3688             :   /* Allocate an expression node indicating that this is a condition

    3860             : 
    3861        6670 : static void scan_condition(a_statement_ptr  sp,
    3862             :                            a_boolean        *p_is_condition_decl)
    3863             : /*
    3864             : Scan a "condition", which is either an expression or in C++ a condition
    3865             : declaration; if the latter, set *is_condition_decl to TRUE.  This routine
    3866             : is called for if, switch, for, and while statements, but not for do-while
    3867             : statements since they are not allowed to have condition declarations even
    3868             : in C++.
    3869             : */
    3870             : {
    3871        6670 :   a_disambig_flag_set          flags = DFS_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED |
    3872             :                                        DFS_IS_CONDITION;
    3873        6670 :   an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr  entity_list;
    3874        6670 :   a_boolean                    is_condition_decl, potential_decl_stmt = FALSE;
    3875             : 
    3876        6670 :   if (sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_for) {
    3877             :     flags |= DFS_CONDITION_IS_FOR_STMT;
    3878        5728 :   } else if (selection_initializers_enabled &&
    3879             :              (sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_if ||
    3880           0 :               sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_constexpr_if ||
    3881             :               sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_switch)) {
    3882           0 :     start_potential_decl_statement(&entity_list);
    3883           0 :     potential_decl_stmt = TRUE;
    3884             :   }  /* if */
    3885        6670 :   if (!C_mode() && is_decl_not_expr(flags)) {
    3886             :     /* A condition declaration.  Start a scope for the variable declared in
    3887             :        the condition and scan the declaration. */
    3888          56 :     is_condition_decl = TRUE;
    3889          56 :     scan_structured_control_value(sp, (an_init_component*)NULL);
    3890             :   } else {
    3891        6614 :     is_condition_decl = FALSE;
    3892        6614 :     if (potential_decl_stmt) {
    3893           0 :       end_potential_decl_statement();
    3894             :     }  /* if */
    3895             :   }  /* if */
    3896          56 :   if (is_condition_decl) {
    3897             :     /* Nothing more to scan. */
    3898             :   } else {
    3899        6614 :     an_init_component_ptr  cache = NULL;
    3900        6614 :     if (potential_decl_stmt && !is_condition_decl) {
    3901             :       /* An expression is next, but it may be followed by a condition
    3902             :          declaration.  Cache the expression and check for a semicolon that
    3903             :          follows it. */
    3904           0 :       cache = cache_expression();

    3906           0 :         scan_structured_control_value(sp, cache);
    3907           0 :         is_condition_decl = TRUE;
    3908             :       }  /* if */

    3910           0 :     if (is_condition_decl) {
    3911             :       /* Nothing more to scan. */
    3912        6614 :     } else if (sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_switch) {
    3913             :       /* Scan the controlling expression and check to see that it is
    3914             :          integral. */
    3915           1 :       sp->expr = scan_integer_expression(/*is_switch_expr=*/TRUE, cache);
    3916             :     } else {
    3917             :       /* Scan the controlling expression and check to see that it is scalar. */
    3918        6613 :       sp->expr = scan_boolean_controlling_expression(cache);
    3919             :     }  /* if */
    3920             :   }  /* if */
    3921        6670 :   if (is_condition_decl) {
    3922          56 :     *p_is_condition_decl = TRUE;
    3923             :   }  /* if */
    3924        6670 : }  /* scan_condition */
    3925             : 
    3926             : 
    3927         712 : static void push_statement_scope(void)
    3928             : /*
    3929             : In C99, iteration and selection statements are surrounded by an implicit
    3930             : scope.  This routine is called at the beginning of such statements,
    3931             : and pushes a generated block statement.
    3932             : */

    3934         712 :   (void)start_block_statement(/*generated_statement=*/TRUE,
    3935             :                               /*is_statement_expr=*/FALSE,
    3936             :                               (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
    3937             :   /* Move any pragmas for the statement (previously selected in
    3938             :      "statement") to the new level in the scope stack. */

    3940         712 :                        scope_stack[depth_scope_stack-1].curr_construct_pragmas;
    3941             :   /* Propagate the position of the iteration or selection statement that is

    3944         712 :                                      (&struct_stmt_stack_top()-1)->p_start_pos;
    3945         712 :   scope_stack[depth_scope_stack-1].curr_construct_pragmas = NULL;
    3946         712 : }  /* push_statement_scope */
    3947             : 
    3948             : 
    3949         712 : static void pop_statement_scope(void)
    3950             : /*
    3951             : In C99, iteration and selection statements are surrounded by an implicit

    3953             : the generated block statement pushed by push_statement_scope.

    3957             :

    3960             : 
    3961             : 
    3962           0 : static void set_in_discarded_statement_flag(a_boolean   value)
    3963             : /*

    3975             :   }  /* if */

    3978             : 
    3979        5313 : static void if_statement(void)
    3980             : /*
    3981             : Scan an "if" statement (with or without else) and add it to the current
    3982             : statement sequence.  The syntax is:
    3983             : 
    3984             :         if constexpr   ( condition ) statement
    3985             :                     opt
    3986             :         if constexpr   ( condition ) statement else statement
    3987             :                     opt
    3988             : 
    3989             : */

    4210           1 : static void switch_statement(void)
    4211             : /*
    4212             : Scan a "switch" statement and add it to the current statement sequence.
    4213             : The syntax is:
    4214             : 
    4215             : 3.6.4  selection-statement:
    4216             :                 switch ( expression ) statement
    4217             : 
    4218             : See also 3.6.4.2.
    4219             : */
    4220             : {
    4221           1 :   a_statement_ptr           sp;
    4222           1 :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp;
    4223           1 :   a_boolean                 is_condition_decl = FALSE;
    4224             : 
    4225           1 :   db_enter(3, "switch_statement");
    4226             : 
    4227           1 :   check_for_unreachable_code();
    4228             :   /* Push a scope in C99 mode. */
    4229           1 :   if (c99_mode) push_statement_scope();
    4230             :   /* Allocate the statement. */
    4231           2 :   sp = add_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_switch);
    4232           1 :   stmt_update_source_sequence_list(sp);
    4233             :   /* Do processing required for any pragmas that are bound to the current
    4234             :      statement. */
    4235           1 :   process_curr_construct_pragmas((a_symbol_ptr)NULL, sp);
    4236             :   /* Push an entry on the structured statement stack. */
    4237           1 :   push_stmt_stack(ssk_switch, sp, (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
    4238             :   /* Ignore the initial "switch". */
    4239           1 :   check_assertion_str(curr_token == tok_switch,
    4240           1 :                       "switch_statement: expected switch");
    4241           1 :   (void)get_token();
    4242             :   /* Check for and skip the opening parenthesis. */
    4243           1 :   (void)required_token(tok_lparen, ec_exp_lparen);
    4244           1 :   add_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    4245             :   /* Scan the "condition", which in C++ may be a condition declaration. */
    4246           1 :   scan_condition(sp, &is_condition_decl);
    4247           1 :   if (!is_error_node(sp->expr)) {
    4248             :     /* Issue a remark if the selector is constant. */
    4249           1 :     if (is_constant_node(skip_parens(sp->expr))) {
    4250           0 :       pos_remark(ec_switch_selector_expr_is_constant, &error_position);
    4251             :     }  /* if */
    4252             :   }  /* if */
    4253             :   /* Add a switch block entry to the control_flow_descr_list.  The
    4254             :      corresponding end-of-entry is added at the end of this routine.  This
    4255             :      is done even though a switch statement usually involves a compound
    4256             :      statement, which could also serve as the switch block.  It's done
    4257             :      this way to handle the unusual case as well, e.g.,
    4258             :        switch (i) if (i > 0) ++i; else { int j = i; i += j; case 0:; }
    4259             :      Also, set the source position of "switch" in the entry that's
    4260             :      created. */
    4261           1 :   cfdp = alloc_control_flow_descr((a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_block);
    4262           1 :   cfdp->source_pos = sp->position;
    4263           1 :   cfdp->variant.block.is_switch_block = TRUE;
    4264           1 :   add_to_control_flow_descr_list(cfdp);
    4265             :   /* Save the selector expression type for checking of the case label
    4266             :      values. */
    4267           1 :   struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack].type = sp->expr->type;
    4268             :   /* Check for and skip the closing parenthesis. */
    4269           1 :   (void)required_token(tok_rparen, ec_exp_rparen);
    4270           1 :   remove_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    4271             :   /* The body of a switch is not reachable until a case or default label
    4272             :      appears.  Note that set_unreachable should not be called until after
    4273             :      the condition declaration, if any, is scanned. */
    4274           1 :   set_unreachable(curr_reachability);
    4275             :   /* Scan the dependent statement. */
    4276           1 :   dependent_statement();
    4277             :   /* If any switch case was template-dependent, discard the sorted list since
    4278             :      its semantics are marginal. */
    4279           1 :   if (struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack].switch_has_dependent_case) {
    4280           0 :     a_switch_case_entry_ptr  scep = sp->variant.switch_stmt.extra_info->cases;
    4281           0 :     for (; scep != NULL; scep = scep->next) {
    4282           0 :       scep->next_on_sorted_list = NULL;
    4283             :     }  /* for */
    4284           0 :     sp->variant.switch_stmt.extra_info->sorted_cases = NULL;
    4285             :   }  /* if */
    4286           1 :   add_to_control_flow_descr_list(
    4287             :       alloc_control_flow_descr((a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_end_of_block));
    4288             :   /* End the condition block, if necessary. */
    4289           1 :   if (is_condition_decl) finish_condition_block();
    4290             :   /* Pop the structured statement stack. */
    4291           1 :   pop_stmt_stack();
    4292             :   /* If a label appeared in the context of the statement that was just
    4293             :      terminated, it may be appropriate to push a new object lifetime for
    4294             :      the scope being resumed. */
    4295           1 :   reset_curr_block_object_lifetime(sp);
    4296             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    4297           1 :   sp->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    4298             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    4299             :   /* Pop a scope in C99 mode. */
    4300           1 :   if (c99_mode) pop_statement_scope();
    4301             : 
    4302           1 :   db_exit();
    4303           1 : }  /* switch_statement */
    4304             : 
    4305             : 
    4306           0 : static void warn_if_loop_has_no_labels(a_source_position  *stmt_pos)
    4307             : /*
    4308             : This routine is called at the end of a loop construct if the caller has
    4309             : determined that the beginning of the loop is not sequentially reachable from
    4310             : the prior statement.  This routine issues a "not reachable" warning at the
    4311             : given position if the loop doesn't contains a (user declared) label definition
    4312             : or active switch case (which means the loop cannot be reached at all).
    4313             : */
    4314             : {
    4315           0 :   if (!struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack].contains_user_label &&
    4316             :       !struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack].contains_active_switch_case) {
    4317           0 :     pos_warning(ec_loop_not_reachable, stmt_pos);
    4318           0 :     curr_reachability.suppress_unreachable_warning = TRUE;
    4319             :   }  /* if */
    4320           0 : }  /* warn_if_loop_has_no_labels */
    4321             : 
    4322             : 
    4323         414 : static void while_statement(void)
    4324             : /*
    4325             : Scan a "while" statement and add it to the current statement sequence.
    4326             : The syntax is:
    4327             : 
    4328             : 3.6.5  iteration-statement:
    4329             :                 while ( expression ) statement
    4330             : 
    4331             : See also 3.6.5.1.
    4332             : */
    4333             : {
    4334         414 :   a_statement_ptr    sp;
    4335         414 :   a_boolean          is_condition_decl = FALSE, assume_loop_reachable;
    4336         414 :   a_source_position  stmt_pos;
    4337             : 
    4338         414 :   db_enter(3, "while_statement");
    4339             : 
    4340         414 :   stmt_pos = pos_curr_token;
    4341         414 :   assume_loop_reachable = curr_reachability.reachable ||
    4342           0 :                           curr_reachability.suppress_unreachable_warning;
    4343             :   /* Push a scope in C99 mode. */
    4344         414 :   if (c99_mode) push_statement_scope();
    4345             :   /* Allocate the statement. */
    4346         810 :   sp = add_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_while);
    4347         414 :   stmt_update_source_sequence_list(sp);
    4348             :   /* Do processing required for any pragmas that are bound to the current
    4349             :      statement. */
    4350         414 :   process_curr_construct_pragmas((a_symbol_ptr)NULL, sp);
    4351             :   /* Push an entry on the structured statement stack. */
    4352         414 :   push_stmt_stack(ssk_while, sp, (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
    4353             :   /* Ignore the initial "while". */
    4354             : #if CHECKING
    4355         414 :   if (curr_token != tok_while) {
    4356           0 :     internal_error("while_statement: expected while");
    4357             :   }  /* if */
    4358             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    4359         414 :   (void)get_token();
    4360             :   /* Check for and skip the opening parenthesis. */
    4361         414 :   (void)required_token(tok_lparen, ec_exp_lparen);
    4362         414 :   add_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    4363             :   /* Scan the condition, which in C++ may be a condition declaration. */
    4364         414 :   scan_condition(sp, &is_condition_decl);
    4365             :   /* Check for and skip the closing parenthesis. */
    4366         414 :   (void)required_token(tok_rparen, ec_exp_rparen);
    4367         414 :   remove_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    4368             :   /* Scan the dependent statement. */
    4369         414 :   dependent_statement();
    4370         414 :   if (!assume_loop_reachable) warn_if_loop_has_no_labels(&stmt_pos);
    4371             :   /* Define the "continue" label, if it is needed. */
    4372         414 :   define_continue_label();
    4373             :   /* End the condition block, if necessary. */
    4374         414 :   if (is_condition_decl) finish_condition_block();
    4375             :   /* Pop the structured statement stack. */
    4376         414 :   pop_stmt_stack();
    4377             :   /* If a label appeared in the context of the statement that was just
    4378             :      terminated, it may be appropriate to push a new object lifetime for
    4379             :      the scope being resumed. */
    4380         414 :   reset_curr_block_object_lifetime(sp);
    4381             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    4382         414 :   sp->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    4383             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    4384             :   /* Pop a scope in C99 mode. */
    4385         414 :   if (c99_mode) pop_statement_scope();
    4386         414 :   db_exit();
    4387         414 : }  /* while_statement */
    4388             : 
    4389             : 
    4390          57 : static void do_statement(void)
    4391             : /*
    4392             : Scan a "do" statement and add it to the current statement sequence.
    4393             : The syntax is:
    4394             : 
    4395             : 3.6.5  iteration-statement:
    4396             :                 do statement while ( expression )
    4397             : 
    4398             : See also 3.6.5.2.
    4399             : */
    4400             : {
    4401          57 :   a_statement_ptr    sp;
    4402          57 :   a_boolean          assume_loop_reachable;
    4403          57 :   a_source_position  stmt_pos;
    4404             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    4405          57 :   a_source_position  saved_while_position;
    4406             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    4407             : 
    4408          57 :   db_enter(3, "do_statement");
    4409             : 
    4410          57 :   stmt_pos = pos_curr_token;
    4411          57 :   assume_loop_reachable = curr_reachability.reachable ||
    4412           0 :                           curr_reachability.suppress_unreachable_warning;
    4413             :   /* Push a scope in C99 mode. */
    4414          57 :   if (c99_mode) push_statement_scope();
    4415             :   /* Allocate the statement. */
    4416         114 :   sp = add_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_end_test_while);
    4417          57 :   stmt_update_source_sequence_list(sp);
    4418             :   /* Do processing required for any pragmas that are bound to the current
    4419             :      statement. */
    4420          57 :   process_curr_construct_pragmas((a_symbol_ptr)NULL, sp);
    4421             :   /* Push an entry on the structured statement stack. */
    4422          57 :   push_stmt_stack(ssk_do, sp, (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
    4423             :   /* Ignore the initial "do". */
    4424             : #if CHECKING
    4425          57 :   if (curr_token != tok_do) internal_error("do_statement: expected do");
    4426             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    4427          57 :   (void)get_token();
    4428             :   /* Scan the dependent statement. */
    4429          57 :   add_stop_token(tok_while);
    4430          57 :   dependent_statement();
    4431          57 :   if (!assume_loop_reachable) warn_if_loop_has_no_labels(&stmt_pos);
    4432             :   /* Define the "continue" label, if it is needed. */
    4433          57 :   define_continue_label();
    4434             :   /* Check for and skip the keyword "while". */
    4435             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    4436          57 :   saved_while_position = pos_curr_token;
    4437             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    4438          57 :   (void)required_token(tok_while, ec_exp_while);
    4439          57 :   remove_stop_token(tok_while);
    4440          57 :   add_stop_token(tok_semicolon);

    4442             :   /* Add an end-of-construct source sequence entry to indicate the location of
    4443             :      the "while" clause.  This allows pragmas and such to be represented when
    4444             :      they occur between the dependent statement and the "while" keyword. */

    4446             :                                           (a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_statement);

    4458             :   }  /* if */
    4459             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    4460             :   /* Check for and skip the opening parenthesis. */
    4461          57 :   (void)required_token(tok_lparen, ec_exp_lparen);
    4462          57 :   add_stop_token(tok_rparen);

    4488             : 
    4489             : 
    4490         514 : static void start_of_try_block(a_statement_ptr  sp)
    4491             : /*
    4492             : Do initialization for a try-block statement or a function-try-block.  The
    4493             : current token should be "try", which is consumed.
    4494             : */
    4495             : {
    4496         514 :   db_enter(3, "start_of_try_block");
    4497         514 :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_try);
    4498             :   /* Do processing required for any pragmas that are bound to the current
    4499             :      statement. */
    4500         514 :   process_curr_construct_pragmas((a_symbol_ptr)NULL, sp);
    4501             :   /* Push an entry on the structured statement stack. */
    4502         514 :   push_stmt_stack(ssk_try_block, sp, (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
    4503         514 :   if (!C_mode()) {
    4504             :     /* Push an object lifetime. */
    4505         514 :     push_object_lifetime(iek_try_supplement, (char *)sp->variant.try_block,
    4506             :                          (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_try_block);
    4507             :   }  /* if */
    4508         514 :   current_routine_entry()->contains_try_block = TRUE;
    4509         514 :   if (!exceptions_enabled) {
    4510             :     /* Support for exceptions is suppressed for this compilation. */
    4511           0 :     pos_error(ec_no_exception_support, &pos_curr_token);
    4512             :   } else {
    4513             :     /* Exceptions are outside the "Embedded C++" subset. */
    4514         514 :     feature_is_not_part_of_embedded_cplusplus_subset(
    4515             :                                         &pos_curr_token,
    4516         514 :                                         ec_exceptions_in_embedded_cplusplus);
    4517         514 :     statement_not_allowed_inside_statement_expression(&pos_curr_token);
    4518         514 :     if (microsoft_mode && warn_on_try_statement) {
    4519             :       /* Emulate the warning that MSVC++ provides when no /EH command line
    4520             :          option is specified. */
    4521             :       pos_warning(ec_exception_handler_used, &pos_curr_token);
    4522             :       (void)set_severity_for_error_number((int)ec_exception_handler_used,
    4523             :                                           es_once, /*make_default=*/FALSE);
    4524             :     }  /* if */
    4525             :   }  /* if */
    4526             :   /* Bypass "try". */
    4527         514 :   (void)get_token();
    4528         514 :   db_exit();
    4529         514 : }  /* start_of_try_block */
    4530             : 
    4531             : 
    4532         514 : static void try_block_statement(a_statement_ptr  sp,
    4533             :                                 a_boolean        explicit_return_type)
    4534             : /*
    4535             : Scan a C++ try-block statement.  Its form is:
    4536             : 
    4537             :   try compound-statement handler-seq
    4538             : 
    4539             : where handler-seq is a sequence of one or more handlers of the form
    4540             : 
    4541             :   catch ( exception-declaration ) compound-statement
    4542             : 
    4543             : In C++/CLI mode, the following forms are also accepted (see ECMA-372 A.16):
    4544             : 
    4545             :    try compound-statement finally-clause
    4546             :    try compound-statement handler-seq finally-clause
    4547             : 
    4548             : where finally-clause is of the form:
    4549             : 
    4550             :    finally compound-statement
    4551             : 
    4552             : This function is also called to scan a function try block, in which case the
    4553             : "try" keyword will already have been consumed and other initialization done.
    4554             : sp points to an stmk_try_block statement when a function try block is being
    4555             : scanned but is NULL for an ordinary try-block.  explicit_return_type is TRUE
    4556             : only for function try blocks and only when the associated function was
    4557             : declared with an explicit return type.
    4558             : */
    4559             : {
    4560         514 :   a_source_position  catch_pos;
    4561         514 :   a_boolean          is_function_try_block;
    4562         514 :   a_boolean          catch_exists;
    4563             : 
    4564         514 :   db_enter(3, "try_block_statement");
    4565             :   /* The statement will already have been created for function try blocks. */
    4566         514 :   is_function_try_block = sp != NULL;
    4567             :   /* Allocate the statement. */
    4568         514 :   if (!is_function_try_block) {
    4569         514 :     check_for_unreachable_code();
    4570        1028 :     sp = add_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_try_block);
    4571         514 :     stmt_update_source_sequence_list(sp);
    4572         514 :     start_of_try_block(sp);
    4573             :   }  /* if */
    4574             :   /* "catch" is not put into the stop tokens set on purpose because the
    4575             :      guarded statement is always a compound statement.  It wouldn't do
    4576             :      any good and could cause looping on errors. */
    4577             :   /* Scan the compound statement, and save a pointer to it in the try-block
    4578             :      statement. */
    4579        1028 :   sp->variant.try_block->statement =
    4580         514 :                           compound_statement(/*at_function_level=*/FALSE,
    4581             :                                              explicit_return_type,
    4582             :                                              /*is_catch_clause=*/FALSE,
    4583             :                                              /*is_statement_expr=*/FALSE);
    4584             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    4585         514 :   sp->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    4586             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    4587             :   /* The next token should be a "catch" introducing the first handler. */
    4588             :   /* Save the current token position as catch_pos before checking whether
    4589             :      it is in fact tok_catch, since the function that checks also advances
    4590             :      past it. */
    4591         514 :   catch_pos = pos_curr_token;
    4592             :   /* If C++/CLI mode is not enabled, catch is required here.  Otherwise,
    4593             :      it can be omitted provided there is a "finally". */
    4594         514 :   if (!cli_or_cx_enabled) {
    4595         514 :     catch_exists = required_token(tok_catch, ec_missing_handler);
    4596             :   } else {
    4597             :     catch_exists = curr_token == tok_catch;
    4598             :     if (catch_exists) (void)get_token();
    4599             :   }  /* if */
    4600         514 :   if (catch_exists) {
    4601             :     /* Loop through the (1 or more) handler declarations, adding each to
    4602             :        the linked list of handlers pointed to by sp. */
    4603         802 :     do {
    4604         802 :       term_stmt_clause(&struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack]);
    4605         802 :       start_stmt_clause(&struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack]);
    4606         802 :       handler_declaration(sp, &catch_pos, is_function_try_block);
    4607             :       /* Again, save the current token position as catch_pos before
    4608             :          checking. */
    4609         802 :       catch_pos = pos_curr_token;
    4610         802 :     } while (loop_token(tok_catch));
    4611             :   }  /* if */
    4612             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4613             :   if (cli_or_cx_enabled) {
    4614             :     if (curr_token == tok_finally ||
    4615             :         (curr_token == tok_identifier &&
    4616             :          curr_token_is_identifier_string("finally") &&
    4617             :          next_token() == tok_lbrace)) {
    4618             :       /* Scan the "finally" clause allowed in C++/CLI (__finally is also
    4619             :          permitted by MS). */
    4620             :       (void)get_token();
    4621             :       term_stmt_clause(&struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack]);
    4622             :       start_stmt_clause(&struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack]);
    4623             :       struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack].parsing_finally_clause = TRUE;
    4624             :       sp->variant.try_block->finally_statement =
    4625             :         compound_statement(/*at_function_level=*/FALSE,
    4626             :                            explicit_return_type,
    4627             :                            /*is_catch_clause=*/FALSE,
    4628             :                            /*is_statement_expr=*/FALSE);
    4629             :       
    4630             :       sp->variant.try_block->finally_statement->parent = sp;
    4631             :       struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack].parsing_finally_clause = FALSE;
    4632             :     } else if (!catch_exists) {
    4633             :       /* Neither "catch" nor "finally" was specified. Use required_token to
    4634             :          issue the diagnostic and advance the token stream as above. */
    4635             :       (void)required_token(tok_catch, ec_missing_finally);
    4636             :     }  /* if */
    4637             :   }  /* if */
    4638             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4639         514 :   if (!C_mode()) (void)pop_object_lifetime();
    4640             :   /* Pop the structured statement stack. */
    4641         514 :   pop_stmt_stack();
    4642             : 
    4643         514 :   db_exit();
    4644         514 : }  /* try_block_statement */
    4645             : 
    4646             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4647             : 
    4648             : static void microsoft_try_statement(void)
    4649             : /*
    4650             : Scan the Microsoft structured exception handling try-finally or try-except
    4651             : statement.  Its form is
    4652             : 
    4653             :   __try compound-statement __finally compound-statement
    4654             :   __try compound_statement __except ( expression) compound_statement
    4655             : 
    4656             : */
    4657             : {
    4658             :   a_statement_ptr sp, block;
    4659             : 
    4660             :   db_enter(3, "microsoft_try_statement");
    4661             :   check_for_unreachable_code();
    4662             :   /* Allocate the statement. */
    4663             :   sp = add_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_microsoft_try);
    4664             :   stmt_update_source_sequence_list(sp);
    4665             :   /* Do processing required for any pragmas that are bound to the current
    4666             :      statement. */
    4667             :   process_curr_construct_pragmas((a_symbol_ptr)NULL, sp);
    4668             :   /* Push an entry on the structured statement stack. */
    4669             :   push_stmt_stack(ssk_microsoft_try, sp, (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
    4670             :   statement_not_allowed_inside_statement_expression(&pos_curr_token);
    4671             : #if CHECKING
    4672             :   if (curr_token != tok_microsoft_try) {
    4673             :     internal_error("microsoft_try_statement: expected __try");
    4674             :   }  /* if */
    4675             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    4676             :   /* Bypass "__try". */
    4677             :   (void)get_token();
    4678             :   /* "__except" and "__finally" are not put into the stop tokens set on
    4679             :      purpose because the guarded statement is always a compound statement.
    4680             :      It wouldn't do any good and could cause looping on errors. */
    4681             :   /* Scan the compound statement, and save a pointer to it in the try
    4682             :      statement. */
    4683             :   sp->variant.microsoft_try->guarded_statement = block =
    4684             :                           compound_statement(/*at_function_level=*/FALSE,
    4685             :                                              /*explicit_return_type=*/FALSE,
    4686             :                                              /*is_catch_clause=*/FALSE,
    4687             :                                              /*is_statement_expr=*/FALSE);
    4688             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    4689             :   sp->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    4690             :   /* The current token should be "__except" or "__finally": */
    4691             :   sp->variant.microsoft_try->except_or_finally_position = pos_curr_token;
    4692             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    4693             :   if (curr_token == tok_except) {
    4694             :     /* __except ( expression ) form. */
    4695             :     (void)get_token();
    4696             :     /* Check for and skip the opening parenthesis. */
    4697             :     (void)required_token(tok_lparen, ec_exp_lparen);
    4698             :     add_stop_token(tok_rparen);

    4700             :     sp->variant.microsoft_try->except_expr =
    4701             :                              scan_integer_expression(/*is_switch_expr=*/FALSE,
    4702             :                                                      (an_init_component*)NULL);
    4703             :     /* Check for and skip the closing parenthesis. */
    4704             :     (void)required_token(tok_rparen, ec_exp_rparen);
    4705             :     remove_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    4706             :   } else if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
    4707             :              (curr_token == tok_identifier &&
    4708             :               curr_token_is_identifier_string("finally") &&
    4709             :               next_token() == tok_lbrace)) {
    4710             :     /* In C++/CLI mode, __try/finally is also accepted. */
    4711             :     (void)get_token();
    4712             :   } else {
    4713             :     /* __finally form. */
    4714             :     (void)required_token(tok_finally, ec_exp_except_or_finally);
    4715             :   }  /* if */
    4716             :   /* Wrap up the block statement and pop the name scope.  (This was not done
    4717             :      in compound_statement because the __except expression has to be scanned
    4718             :      within the name scope belonging to the guarded statement.) */
    4719             :   finish_block_statement(block);
    4720             :   /* Define the "continue" label, if it is needed.  This is the target of
    4721             :      __leave statements. */
    4722             :   define_continue_label();
    4723             :   /* Scan the cleanup statement. */
    4724             :   term_stmt_clause(&struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack]);

    4740             : 
    4741         969 : static void empty_statement(void)
    4742             : /*
    4743             : Do processing appropriate to an empty statement -- typically, just a
    4744             : semicolon.  However, this routine is also called for some error cases as
    4745             : well.
    4746             : */
    4747             : {
    4748         969 :   a_statement_ptr  esp;
    4749             : 
    4750         969 :   db_enter(3, "empty_statement");
    4751         969 :   if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
    4752             :     /* Issue diagnostics on pragmas that are trying to bind to the empty
    4753             :        statement. */
    4754         969 :     cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
    4755             :   } else {
    4756             :     /* Must be an error case.  Discard any pragmas that are bound to the
    4757             :        current statement. */
    4758           0 :     discard_curr_construct_pragmas();
    4759             :   }  /* if */
    4760        1938 :   esp = add_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_empty);
    4761         969 :   stmt_update_source_sequence_list(esp);
    4762             :   /* Advance past the semicolon. */
    4763         969 :   if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
    4764             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    4765         969 :     curr_construct_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    4766         969 :     esp->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    4767             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    4768         969 :     (void)get_token();
    4769             :   }  /* if */
    4770         969 :   if (esp->is_fallthrough_statement) {
    4771           0 :     struct_stmt_stack_top().fallthrough_statement = esp;
    4772             :   }  /* if */
    4773         969 :   db_exit();
    4774         969 : }  /* empty_statement */
    4775             : 
    4776             : 
    4777          16 : static void add_goto_to_continue_label(
    4778             :                                       a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep,
    4779             :                                       a_boolean                     is_leave,
    4780             :                                       a_statement_ptr               *goto_stmt)
    4781             : /*

    4783             : statement.  Generate the label if it has not been generated yet.

    4848             : static void leave_statement(void)
    4849             : /*
    4850             : Scan a Microsoft "__leave" statement and add it to the current statement
    4851             : sequence.  Such a statement is used to leave a try-finally.
    4852             : The syntax is:

    4854             :   __leave ;

    4996         958 : static void for_init_statement(a_scope_pointers_block_ptr pointers_block)
    4997             : /*

    5053             : 
    5054             : 
    5055         958 : static void for_statement(void)
    5056             : /*
    5057             : Scan a "for" or range-based-for statement and add it to the current statement
    5058             : sequence.  The syntax is:
    5059             : 
    5060             : 3.6.5  iteration-statement:
    5061             :     for ( expr    ; expr    ; expr    ) statement
    5062             :               opt       opt       opt
    5063             : 
    5064             : See also 3.6.5.3.
    5065             : 
    5066             : In C++ the first expression is replaced by for-init-statement, which is
    5067             : either an expression statement or a declaration statement.
    5068             : 
    5069             : The range-based-for syntax ([stmt.ranged]) is:
    5070             : 
    5071             :   for ( for-range-declaration : expression ) statement
    5072             : 
    5073             : In UPC mode, the "upc_forall" construct is also accepted.  It looks much
    5074             : like the standard "for" statement, except for the fourth expression.
    5075             :     for ( expr    ; expr    ; expr    ; affinity    ) statement
    5076             :               opt       opt       opt           opt
    5077             : 
    5078             : The affinity can be an expression or the keyword "continue".
    5079             : */
    5080             : {
    5081         958 :   a_statement_ptr            sp;
    5082         958 :   a_boolean                  saved_flag, assume_loop_reachable;
    5083         958 :   a_boolean                  is_condition_decl = FALSE;
    5084         958 :   a_boolean                  processing_upc_forall = FALSE;
    5085         958 :   a_boolean                  is_range_based_for = FALSE;
    5086         958 :   a_boolean                  need_c99_stmt_scope = FALSE;
    5087             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5088         958 :   an_expr_node_ptr           affinity_expr = NULL;
    5089         958 :   a_statement_ptr            saved_innermost_forall_loop = NULL;
    5090             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5091         958 :   a_source_position          stmt_pos, range_pos;
    5092         958 :   a_token_sequence_number    expr_tok_seq_number;
    5093         958 :   a_range_based_for_loop_ptr rbflp = NULL;
    5094         958 :   a_scope_pointers_block     iterator_pointers_block, middle_pointers_block;
    5095             : 
    5096         958 :   db_enter(3, "for_statement");
    5097             : 
    5098         958 :   stmt_pos = pos_curr_token;
    5099         958 :   assume_loop_reachable = curr_reachability.reachable ||
    5100           0 :                           curr_reachability.suppress_unreachable_warning;
    5101             :   /* In C99, the statement itself has an associated scope.  Microsoft C also
    5102             :      implements this starting with version 18.00. */
    5103         958 :   need_c99_stmt_scope = c99_mode || (C_mode() && microsoft_mode &&
    5104             :                                      microsoft_version >= 1800);
    5105         479 :   if (need_c99_stmt_scope) push_statement_scope();

    5109             :     /* This is a UPC forall statement. */

    5122        1437 :       sp = add_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_for);
    5123             :     }  /* if */

    5164           0 :     for_range_declaration(&dps);

    5169             :       }  /* if */

    5171             :     /* Pop two scopes to get back to the scope where the expression needs to

    5174           0 :     pop_block_scope(/*is_final_pop=*/FALSE);

    5178             :     /* Scan the expression. */
    5179           0 :     expr_tok_seq_number = curr_token_sequence_number;

    5181             :     /* Perform the semantic checks and build the IL. */

    5183             :                                     &range_pos,
    5184             :                                     expr_tok_seq_number,
    5185             :                                     &middle_pointers_block,
    5186             :                                     &iterator_pointers_block);
    5187             :     /* Return to the iterator scope for the dependent statement. */
    5188           0 :     push_block_reactivation_scope(rbflp->begin_end_scope,
    5189             :                                   &middle_pointers_block);

    5191             :                                   &iterator_pointers_block);
    5192           0 :     if (dps.is_struct_binding_decl) {
    5193           0 :       define_struct_bindings(&dps);
    5194             :     }  /* if */
    5195             :   } else {
    5196             :     /* A plain-old-for loop (or a UPC forall). */
    5197             :     /* Scan the initializing expression or declaration if it is present.  It
    5198             :        will be added to the correct place in the stmk_for entry. */
    5199         958 :     add_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
    5200         958 :     for_init_statement(&iterator_pointers_block);

    5451           0 : static void report_goto_past_init(a_control_flow_descr_ptr  start_cfdp,
