    5598             : 
    5599           1 : static void check_goto_and_label(a_control_flow_descr_ptr  label_cfdp,
    5600             :                                  a_control_flow_descr_ptr  goto_cfdp,
    5601             :                                  a_boolean                 is_forward)
    5602             : /*
    5603             : If is_forward is TRUE, a goto was previously recorded in goto_cfdp and now
    5604             : that the label it referenced has been encountered (represented by label_cfdp)
    5605             : we can determine whether the goto entailed jumping over an initializing
    5606             : declaration.  If is_forward is FALSE, a label was encountered previously.
    5607             : we are now at the goto, and the same determination has to be made.  This
    5608             : routine sets up the terms for scanning the control_flow_descr_list to
    5609             : diagnose the condition.
    5610             : */
    5611             : {
    5612           1 :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  cfdp, start_cfdp, common_parent;
    5613           1 :   an_error_severity         severity;
    5614           1 :   an_object_lifetime_ptr    label_olp, *goto_olp_addr;
    5615             : 
    5616           1 :   db_enter(4, "check_goto_and_label");
    5617           1 :   if (is_forward && goto_cfdp->variant.goto_statement.prev_goto != NULL) {
    5618             :     /* All forward gotos to a given label are linked together by the
    5619             :        prev_goto field of the control-flow-descr entries.  Follow the list
    5620             :        up to process them in the order they appear in the program. */
    5621           0 :     check_goto_and_label(label_cfdp,
    5622             :                          goto_cfdp->variant.goto_statement.prev_goto,
    5623             :                          /*is_forward=*/TRUE);
    5624             :   }  /* if */
    5625           1 :   start_cfdp = NULL;
    5626             : #if DEBUG
    5627           1 :   if (debug_level >= 4) {
    5628           0 :     fprintf(f_debug, "checking %s jump from:  ",
    5629             :             is_forward ? "forward" : "backwards");
    5630           0 :     db_cfd_and_parents(goto_cfdp);
    5631           0 :     fprintf(f_debug, "...and jumping to:  ");
    5632           0 :     db_cfd_and_parents(label_cfdp);
    5633             :   }  /* if */
    5634             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5635             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5636           1 :   if (label_cfdp->enclosing_forall != goto_cfdp->enclosing_forall) {
    5637             :     /* goto and label are either in different forall statements or one is in
    5638             :        a forall and the other is not.  (The UPC specification indicates that
    5639             :        this leads to undefined behavior when executed.)   */
    5640           0 :     pos_warning(ec_exit_forall, &goto_cfdp->source_pos);
    5641             :   }  /* if */
    5642             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5643           1 :   if (check_for_branch_into_goto_protected_block(label_cfdp, goto_cfdp)) {
    5644             :     /* Ignore the jump-over-initialization errors -- this is an illegal
    5645             :        branch into a catch clause or try block.  (The diagnostic has
    5646             :        already been issued.) */
    5647           1 :   } else if (label_cfdp->parent == goto_cfdp->parent) {
    5648             :     /* Label and goto are in the same block:
    5649             : 
    5650             :            goto L;             // forward goto
    5651             :                : FFFFF         
    5652             :                : FFFFF
    5653             :                : FFFFF
    5654             :            L:
    5655             :                :
    5656             :            goto L;             // backwards goto
    5657             : 
    5658             :        In this case the region marked "FFFFF" needs to be searched for
    5659             :        forward gotos, but backwards gotos are always allowed. */
    5660           0 :     if (is_forward) {
    5661             :       /* Start looking for initializing declarations at the point immediately
    5662             :          following the goto statement. */
    5663           0 :       start_cfdp = goto_cfdp->next;
    5664             :     }  /* if */
    5665           2 :   } else if (is_on_cfd_parent_list(goto_cfdp->parent, label_cfdp)) {
    5666             :     /* A goto from an outer block to a label in a nested block:
    5667             : 
    5668             :            goto L;             // forward goto
    5669             :                : FFFFF
    5670             :            {     FFFFF         // start of inner block
    5671             :                : FFFFF BBBBB
    5672             :                : FFFFF BBBBB
    5673             :            L:
    5674             :                :
    5675             :            }                   // end of inner block
    5676             :            goto L;             // backwards goto
    5677             : 
    5678             :        The region marked "FFFFF" is searched for forward gotos, and the
    5679             :        region marked "BBBBB" is searched for backward gotos. */
    5680           0 :     if (is_forward) {
    5681             :       /* Start looking for initializing declarations at the point immediately
    5682             :          following the goto statement. */
    5683           0 :       start_cfdp = goto_cfdp->next;
    5684             :     } else {
    5685             :       /* Start looking for initializing declarations at the top of the
    5686             :          outermost block that both contains the label and is contained by
    5687             :          the block to which the goto belongs. */
    5688             :       cfdp = label_cfdp->parent;
    5689           0 :       while (cfdp->parent != goto_cfdp->parent) {
    5690             :         cfdp = cfdp->parent;
    5691             :       }  /* while */
    5692           0 :       start_cfdp = cfdp->next;
    5693             :     }  /* if */
    5694           4 :   } else if (is_on_cfd_parent_list(label_cfdp->parent, goto_cfdp)) {
    5695             :     /* A goto from an inner block to a label in an outer block:
    5696             : 
    5697             :            {                     // start of inner block
    5698             :              goto L;             // forward goto
    5699             :            }                     // end of inner block
    5700             :                : FFFFF
    5701             :                : FFFFF
    5702             :                : FFFFF
    5703             :            L:
    5704             :                :
    5705             :            {                     // start of inner block
    5706             :              goto L;             // backwards goto
    5707             :            }                     // end of inner block
    5708             : 
    5709             :        The region marked "FFFFF" is searched for forward gotos, but
    5710             :        backwards gotos are always allowed. */
    5711           1 :     if (is_forward) {
    5712             :       /* Start looking for initializing declarations at the point immediately
    5713             :          following the outermost block that both contains the goto and is
    5714             :          contained by the block to which the label belongs. */
    5715             :       cfdp = goto_cfdp->parent;
    5716           0 :       while (cfdp->parent != label_cfdp->parent) {
    5717             :         cfdp = cfdp->parent;
    5718             :       }  /* while */
    5719           0 :       start_cfdp = cfdp->variant.block.end_of_block->next;
    5720             :     }  /* if */
    5721             :   } else {
    5722             :     /* goto from an inner block to a label in an inner block.
    5723             : 
    5724             :            {                     // start of inner block
    5725             :              goto L;             // forward goto
    5726             :            }                     // end of inner block
    5727             :                : FFFFF
    5728             :            {     FFFFF           // start of inner block
    5729             :                : FFFFF BBBBB
    5730             :                : FFFFF BBBBB
    5731             :            L:
    5732             :                :
    5733             :            }                     // end of inner block
    5734             : 
    5735             :            {                     // start of inner block
    5736             :              goto L;             // forward goto
    5737             :            }                     // end of inner block
    5738             : 
    5739             :        The region marked "FFFFF" is searched for forward gotos, and the
    5740             :        region marked "BBBBB" is searched for backward gotos. */
    5741             :     /* Find the block that is the "common parent" -- the innermost block
    5742             :        containing both the goto and the label. */
    5743             :     common_parent = label_cfdp->parent;
    5744           0 :     while (!is_on_cfd_parent_list(common_parent, goto_cfdp->parent)) {
    5745           0 :       common_parent = common_parent->parent;
    5746             :     }  /* while */
    5747             : #if DEBUG
    5748           0 :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
    5749           0 :       fprintf(f_debug, " common parent = ");
    5750           0 :       db_cfd(common_parent);
    5751             :     }  /* if */
    5752             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5753             :     /* For forward gotos, start looking for initializing declarations at the
    5754             :        point immediately following the outermost block that both contains the
    5755             :        goto and is immediately contained by the common parent.  For backwards
    5756             :        gotos, start looking at the top of the outermost block that both
    5757             :        contains the label and is immediately contained by the common parent. */
    5758           0 :     cfdp = is_forward ? goto_cfdp->parent : label_cfdp->parent;
    5759           0 :     check_assertion(cfdp != common_parent);
    5760           0 :     while (cfdp->parent != common_parent) {
    5761             :       cfdp = cfdp->parent;
    5762             :     }  /* while */
    5763           0 :     start_cfdp = is_forward ?
    5764           0 :                    cfdp->variant.block.end_of_block->next : cfdp->next;
    5765             :   }  /* if */
    5766           0 :   if (start_cfdp == NULL) {
    5767             :     /* No checking is required. */
    5768             :   } else {
    5769             :     /* If the above algorithm indicates starting at a block that contains
    5770             :        the label, enter that block and start at its first statement.
    5771             :        (Otherwise the search will try to skip the block.) */
    5772           0 :     a_diagnostic_ptr dp = NULL;
    5773           0 :     while (start_cfdp->kind == (a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_block &&
    5774           0 :            is_on_cfd_parent_list(start_cfdp, label_cfdp)) {
    5775           0 :       start_cfdp = start_cfdp->next;
    5776             :     }  /* if */
    5777             :     /* Now do the search for an initializing declaration.  On the path
    5778             :        between the starting entry, as determined above, and the entry for the
    5779             :        label.  Check the error severity to see if a diagnostic was issued, in
    5780             :        which case terminate the multi-line message. */
    5781           0 :     severity = es_none;
    5782           0 :     report_goto_past_init(start_cfdp, label_cfdp,
    5783             :                           &goto_cfdp->source_pos, &dp, &severity);
    5784           0 :     if (severity != es_none) end_diagnostic(dp);
    5785             :   }  /* if */
    5786           1 :   if (!C_mode()) {
    5787             :     /* Find the common object lifetime containing both the goto statement and
    5788             :        the label, and update the goto statement's lifetime field to point to
    5789             :        it. */
    5790           1 :     label_olp = label_cfdp->variant.label_statement->variant.label.lifetime;
    5791           1 :     goto_olp_addr = &goto_cfdp->variant.goto_statement.ptr->
    5792             :                                                       variant.label.lifetime;
    5793           1 :     *goto_olp_addr = common_object_lifetime(label_olp, *goto_olp_addr);
    5794             :   }  /* if */
    5795             : #if VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL
    5796             :   if (vla_enabled && vla_deallocations_in_il) {
    5797             :     /* Put out vla-dealloc statements on the goto, if necessary. */
    5798             :     add_vla_dealloc_stmts_for_goto(goto_cfdp, label_cfdp);
    5799             :   }  /* if */
    5800             : #endif /* VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL */
    5801           1 :   db_exit();
    5802           1 : }  /* check_goto_and_label */
    5803             : 
    5804             : 
    5805             : static void check_for_jump_over_initialization(a_statement_ptr    sp,
    5806             :                                                a_source_position  *pos)
    5807             : /*
    5808             : sp is either a label statement or a goto statement.  If this is a goto
    5809             : statement and the label it references has not yet been seen (i.e., if it
    5810             : is a "forward goto"), record some information about it for later use in
    5811             : detecting jumps over initializing declarations.  If this is a "backward goto"
    5812             : statement, issue a diagnostic if it jumps over any initializing declarations.
    5813             : If this is a label statement, check the associated forward gotos to see if
    5814             : any of them jumped over initializing declarations.  Diagnostics are put out
    5815             : at the point of the goto statement, even for forward gotos, where the
    5816             : condition is not recognized till the label statement is reached.
    5817             : */
    5818             : {
    5819             :   a_symbol_ptr              label_sym;
    5820             :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr  label_cfdp, goto_cfdp;
    5821             : 
    5822             :   db_enter(3, "check_for_jump_over_initialization");
    5823             :   check_assertion (sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_label ||
    5824             :                    sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_goto);
    5825             :   label_sym = (a_symbol_ptr)sp->variant.label.ptr->source_corresp.assoc_info;
    5826             :   if (sp->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_label) {
    5827             :     /* This is the definition of the label. */
    5828             :     goto_cfdp = label_sym->variant.label.assoc_control_flow_descr;
    5829             :     label_cfdp =
    5830             :             alloc_control_flow_descr((a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_label);
    5831             :     label_cfdp->variant.label_statement = sp;
    5832             :     label_cfdp->source_pos = *pos;
    5833             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5834             :     /* Keep track of any enclosing forall loop to make sure no exits
    5835             :        or entries of forall loops are attempted. */
    5836             :     label_cfdp->enclosing_forall = innermost_forall_loop;
    5837             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5838             :     add_to_control_flow_descr_list(label_cfdp);
    5839             :     label_sym->variant.label.assoc_control_flow_descr = label_cfdp;
    5840             :     if (goto_cfdp != NULL) {
    5841             :       /* There was at least one forward goto referencing this label.  For
    5842             :          each check whether it jumped over any initializing declarations. */
    5843             :       check_goto_and_label(label_cfdp, goto_cfdp, /*is_forward=*/TRUE);
    5844             :     }  /* if */
    5845             :   } else {
    5846             :     /* This is a goto to the label. */
    5847             :     /* Allocate and fill in a goto entry. */
    5848             :     goto_cfdp = alloc_control_flow_descr((a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_goto);
    5849             :     goto_cfdp->source_pos = *pos;
    5850             :     goto_cfdp->variant.goto_statement.ptr = sp;
    5851             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5852             :     /* Keep track of any enclosing forall loop so we can diagnose attempts
    5853             :        to jump into or out of such loops. */
    5854             :     goto_cfdp->enclosing_forall = innermost_forall_loop;
    5855             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5856             :     add_to_control_flow_descr_list(goto_cfdp);
    5857             :     if (label_sym->defined) {
    5858             :       /* This is a backwards goto -- i.e., it references a label that has
    5859             :          already been defined.  Check whether it jumps over any initializing
    5860             :          declarations.  Note that the goto entry has been added to the
    5861             :          control_flow_descr_list; once the checking has been done it is
    5862             :          taken off again, since only forward gotos need to remain on the
    5863             :          list (and then only till the label is seen). */
    5864             :       label_cfdp = label_sym->variant.label.assoc_control_flow_descr;
    5865             :       check_goto_and_label(label_cfdp, goto_cfdp, /*is_forward=*/FALSE);
    5866             :     } else {
    5867             :       /* This is a forward goto -- i.e., it references a label that has not
    5868             :          yet been defined.  Record information about it so that, when the
    5869             :          label definition is reached, a check can made whether it involves
    5870             :          jumping over any initializing declarations. */
    5871             :       goto_cfdp->variant.goto_statement.prev_goto =
    5872             :                         label_sym->variant.label.assoc_control_flow_descr;
    5873             :       label_sym->variant.label.assoc_control_flow_descr = goto_cfdp;
    5874             :     }  /* if */
    5875             :   }  /* if */
    5876             :   db_exit();
    5877             : }  /* check_for_jump_over_initialization */
    5878             : 
    5879             : 
    5880           1 : static void goto_statement(void)
    5881             : /*
    5882             : Scan a "goto" statement and add it to the current statement sequence.
    5883             : The syntax is:
    5884             : 
    5885             : 3.6.6  jump-statement:
    5886             :                 goto identifier ;
    5887             : 
    5888             : See also 3.6.6.1.
    5889             : */
    5890             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5891             : /*
    5892             : GNU allows a syntax similar to Fortran's assigned goto:
    5893             : 
    5894             :         jump_statement:
    5895             :                 goto * expr ;
    5896             : */
    5897             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5898             : {
    5899           1 :   a_statement_ptr    sp;
    5900           1 :   a_source_position  goto_pos;
    5901           1 :   a_statement_kind   stmk;
    5902             : 
    5903           1 :   db_enter(3, "goto_statement");
    5904           1 :   check_for_unreachable_code();
    5905           1 :   stmk = (a_statement_kind)stmk_goto;
    5906             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5907           1 :   if (gnu_mode && next_token() == tok_star) {
    5908           0 :     stmk = (a_statement_kind)stmk_assigned_goto;
    5909           0 :     if (strict_ansi_mode) {
    5910           0 :       diagnostic(strict_ansi_error_severity, ec_nonstd_assigned_goto);
    5911             :     }  /* if */
    5912             :   }  /* if */
    5913             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5914             :   /* Allocate the statement. */
    5915           2 :   sp = add_statement(stmk);
    5916           1 :   stmt_update_source_sequence_list(sp);
    5917             :   /* Do processing required for any pragmas that are bound to the current
    5918             :      statement. */
    5919           1 :   process_curr_construct_pragmas((a_symbol_ptr)NULL, sp);
    5920           1 :   goto_pos = pos_curr_token;
    5921             :   /* Ignore the initial "goto". */
    5922             : #if CHECKING
    5923           1 :   if (curr_token != tok_goto) internal_error("goto_statement: expected goto");
    5924             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    5925           1 :   (void)get_token();
    5926           1 :   add_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
    5927             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5928           1 :   if (stmk == (a_statement_kind)stmk_assigned_goto) {
    5929             :     /* Discard the star. */
    5930             : #if CHECKING
    5931           0 :     if (curr_token != tok_star) internal_error("goto_statement: expected '*'");
    5932             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    5933           0 :     (void)get_token();
    5934             :     /* Scan the expression following, which must have type (void *).
    5935             :        const void * is also acceptable. */
    5936           0 :     sp->expr = scan_typed_expression(make_pointer_type(void_type()),
    5937             :                                      make_pointer_type(
    5938             :                                        make_qualified_type(void_type(),
    5939             :                                                            TQ_CONST)),
    5940             :                                      ec_assigned_goto_requires_void_ptr);
    5941             :   } else
    5942             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5943             :   /* Do not insert code here. */
    5944             :   {
    5945             :     /* Scan the label identifier. */
    5946           1 :     sp->variant.label.ptr = scan_label(/*is_definition=*/FALSE,
    5947             :                                        /*is_declaration=*/FALSE);
    5948           1 :     if (!C_mode()) {
    5949             :       /* Set the object lifetime.  It is a provisional setting and may
    5950             :          be changed based on the lifetime of the label definition. */
    5951           1 :       sp->variant.label.lifetime =
    5952           1 :                         innermost_block_object_lifetime(curr_object_lifetime);
    5953             :     }  /* if */
    5954             :     /* If this is a forward reference to a label, record information about
    5955             :        the goto to allow diagnosis of jump-over-initialization errors.  If
    5956             :        it is backward reference, do the checking immediately. */
    5957           1 :     check_for_jump_over_initialization(sp, &goto_pos);
    5958             :   } /* else */
    5959             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    5960           1 :   if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
    5961           1 :     curr_construct_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    5962             :   }  /* if */
    5963           1 :   sp->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    5964             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    5965             :   /* Check for and ignore the final semicolon. */
    5966           1 :   (void)required_token(tok_semicolon, ec_exp_semicolon);
    5967           1 :   remove_stop_token(tok_semicolon);
    5968           1 :   db_exit();
    5969           1 : }  /* goto_statement */
    5970             : 
    5971             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5972             : 
    5973             : static a_boolean has_nested_finally_clause(a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep)
    5974             : /*
    5975             : Return TRUE if a C++/CLI finally clause is nested in the structured statement
    5976             : represented by *sssep.
    5977             : */
    5978             : {
    5979             :   a_boolean result = FALSE;
    5980             : 
    5981             :   check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);
    5982             :   while (sssep != &struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack]) {
    5983             :     if (sssep->parsing_finally_clause) {
    5984             :       result = TRUE;
    5985             :       break;
    5986             :     }  /* if */
    5987             :     sssep++;
    5988             :   }  /* while */
    5989             :   return result;
    5990             : }  /* has_nested_finally_clause */
    5991             : 
    5992             : 
    5993             : #if !COROUTINES_ALLOWED
    5994             : static
    5995             : #endif /* !COROUTINES_ALLOWED */
    5996             : a_boolean inside_finally_clause()
    5997             : /*
    5998             : Return TRUE if the top structured statement is nested in a C++/CLI finally
    5999             : clause.
    6000             : */
    6001             : {
    6002             :   int       depth;
    6003             :   a_boolean result = FALSE;
    6004             : 
    6005             :   check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);
    6006             :   /* Note that we look at entry [0] because we have to consider function
    6007             :      try-blocks. */
    6008             :   for (depth = depth_stmt_stack; depth >= 0; depth--) {
    6009             :     if (struct_stmt_stack[depth].parsing_finally_clause) {
    6010             :       result = TRUE;
    6011             :       break;
    6012             :     }  /* if */
    6013             :   }  /* for */
    6014             :   return result;
    6015             : }  /* inside_finally_clause */
    6016             : 
    6017             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6018             : 
    6019          16 : static void continue_statement(void)
    6020             : /*
    6021             : Scan a "continue" statement and add it to the current statement sequence.
    6022             : The syntax is:
    6023             : 
    6024             : 3.6.6  jump-statement:
    6025             :                 continue ;
    6026             : 
    6027             : See also 3.6.6.2.
    6028             : */
    6029             : {
    6030          16 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep;
    6031          16 :   a_statement_ptr               goto_stmt;
    6032             : 
    6033          16 :   db_enter(3, "continue_statement");
    6034          16 :   check_for_unreachable_code();
    6035             :   /* See if we are within a loop body (while, do, or for) by looking at the
    6036             :      entries in the structured statement stack. */
    6037          16 :   sssep = find_enclosing_struct_stmt(/*find_switch=*/FALSE,
    6038             :                                      /*find_loop=*/TRUE);
    6039          16 :   if (sssep == NULL) {
    6040             :     /* No appropriate structured statement was found. */
    6041           0 :     pos_error(ec_continue_must_be_in_loop, &error_position);
    6042             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6043             :   } else if (cli_or_cx_enabled && has_nested_finally_clause(sssep)) {
    6044             :     /* A continue statement cannot be inside a C++/CLI finally clause. */
    6045             :     pos_error(ec_continue_cannot_be_in_finally_block, &error_position);
    6046             :     sssep = NULL;
    6047             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6048             :   }  /* if */
    6049             :   /* Add a "goto" to the continue label. */
    6050          16 :   add_goto_to_continue_label(sssep, /*is_leave=*/FALSE, &goto_stmt);
    6051             :   /* Ignore the initial "continue". */
    6052             : #if CHECKING
    6053          16 :   if (curr_token != tok_continue) {
    6054           0 :     internal_error("continue_statement: expected continue");
    6055             :   }  /* if */
    6056             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    6057          16 :   (void)get_token();
    6058             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6059          16 :   if (curr_token == tok_semicolon) {
    6060          16 :     curr_construct_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    6061             :   }  /* if */
    6062          16 :   if (goto_stmt != NULL) {
    6063          16 :     goto_stmt->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    6064             :   }  /* if */
    6065             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6066             :   /* Check for and ignore the final semicolon. */
    6067          16 :   (void)required_token(tok_semicolon, ec_exp_semicolon);
    6068          16 :   db_exit();
    6069          16 : }  /* continue_statement */
    6070             : 
    6071             : 
    6072             : #if !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6073             : /* ARGSUSED */ /* <-- end_pos is not used in that case. */
    6074             : #endif /* !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6075             : static void add_goto_for_break(a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep,
    6076             :                                a_source_position             *pos,
    6077             :                                a_source_position             *end_pos)
    6078             : /*
    6079             : Add a goto to implement a break statement.  sssep points to the structured
    6080             : statement stack entry for the statement being exited.  *pos and *end_pos
    6081             : give the starting and ending positions of the break statement.
    6082             : */
    6083             : {
    6084             :   a_statement_ptr               sp;
    6085             :   a_label_ptr                   dest_label;
    6086             :   a_control_flow_descr_ptr      cfdp;
    6087             : 
    6088             :   dest_label = sssep->break_label;
    6089             :   if (dest_label == NULL) {
    6090             :     /* The break label has not previously been used, so generate it. */
    6091             :     dest_label = sssep->break_label = alloc_temp_label();

    6094             :       dest_label->switch_break_label = TRUE;
    6095             :     }  /* if */
    6096             :   }  /* if */
    6097             :   /* Allocate the goto statement. */
    6098             :   sp = add_statement_at_stmt_pos((a_statement_kind)stmk_goto, pos);
    6099             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6100             :   sp->end_position = *end_pos;
    6101             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6102             :   stmt_update_source_sequence_list(sp);
    6103             :   /* Put the destination label into the goto. */
    6104             :   sp->variant.label.ptr = dest_label;
    6105             :   if (!C_mode()) {
    6106             :     /* Set the object lifetime.  It is a provisional setting and may be
    6107             :        changed based on the lifetime of the break label itself. */
    6108             :     sp->variant.label.lifetime =
    6109             :                         innermost_block_object_lifetime(curr_object_lifetime);
    6110             :   }  /* if */
    6111             :   if (!C_mode() || vla_enabled) {
    6112             :     /* Allocate and fill in a goto entry.  This is done in C++ mode
    6113             :        because it's needed for object lifetime management and in C mode
    6114             :        when VLA support is enabled to insert vla-dealloc statements before
    6115             :        forward gotos. */
    6116             :     cfdp = alloc_control_flow_descr((a_control_flow_descr_kind)cfdk_goto);
    6117             :     cfdp->source_pos = pos_curr_token;

    6121             :     sssep->break_statements = cfdp;
    6122             :   }  /* if */
    6123             : }  /* add_goto_for_break */
    6124             : 
    6125             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6126             : 
    6127             : static void check_for_leaving_upc_forall(a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr  sssep)
    6128             : /*
    6129             : We are parsing a break statement.  Issue a warning if it is a reachable break
    6130             : out of a upc_forall statement.  (The UPC specification indicates that this
    6131             : leads to undefined behavior when executed.)  sssep is the statement to which
    6132             : the break applies.
    6133             : */
    6134             : {
    6135             :   if (upc_mode && curr_reachability.reachable_considering_hints &&
    6136             :       sssep->statement != NULL &&
    6137             :       sssep->statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_upc_forall) {
    6138             :     pos_warning(ec_exit_forall, &error_position);
    6139             :   }  /* if */
    6140             : }  /* check_for_leaving_upc_forall */

    6142             : #else /* !UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */

    6144             : #define check_for_leaving_upc_forall(sssep)  /* Nothing */
    6145             :

    6147             : 
    6148         242 : static void break_statement(void)
    6149             : /*
    6150             : Scan a "break" statement and add it to the current statement sequence.
    6151             : The syntax is:
    6152             : 
    6153             : 3.6.6  jump-statement:
    6154             :                 break ;
    6155             : 
    6156             : See also 3.6.6.3.
    6157             : */
    6158             : {
    6159         242 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep;
    6160         242 :   a_source_position             start_position, end_position;
    6161             : 
    6162         242 :   db_enter(3, "break_statement");
    6163         242 :   start_position = pos_curr_token;
    6164         242 :   check_for_unreachable_code();
    6165             :   /* See if we are within a loop body (while, do, or for) or a switch
    6166             :      by looking at the entries in the structured statement stack. */
    6167         242 :   sssep = find_enclosing_struct_stmt(/*find_switch=*/TRUE,
    6168             :                                      /*find_loop=*/TRUE);
    6169             :   /* Binding a pragma to a break statement is disallowed.  This is partly
    6170             :      a consequence of how break statements are implemented -- usually no
    6171             :      explicit goto is added to the IL (so there's nothing to actually connect
    6172             :      the IL pragma entry to). */
    6173         242 :   cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
    6174         242 :   if (sssep == NULL) {
    6175             :     /* No appropriate structured statement was found. */
    6176           0 :     pos_error(ec_break_must_be_in_loop_or_switch, &error_position);
    6177             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6178             :   } else if (cli_or_cx_enabled && has_nested_finally_clause(sssep)) {
    6179             :     /* A break statement cannot be inside a C++/CLI finally clause. */
    6180             :     pos_error(ec_break_cannot_be_in_finally_block, &error_position);
    6181             :     sssep = NULL;
    6182             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6183             :   } else {
    6184         242 :     check_for_leaving_upc_forall(sssep);
    6185         242 :     if (sssep->kind == (a_struct_stmt_kind)ssk_switch &&
    6186           2 :         sssep->statement->variant.switch_stmt.extra_info->cases != NULL) {
    6187             :       /* If this break appears after a case label and is reachable, then we
    6188             :          can presume there is a way out of the switch. */
    6189           2 :       merge_reachability(&curr_reachability, &sssep->end_reachable);
    6190             :     }  /* if */
    6191             :   }  /* if */
    6192             :   /* Advance over the "break". */
    6193             : #if CHECKING
    6194         242 :   if (curr_token != tok_break) {
    6195           0 :     internal_error("break_statement: expected break");
    6196             :   }  /* if */
    6197             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    6198         242 :   (void)get_token();
    6199             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6200         242 :   end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    6201             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6202         242 :   if (sssep != NULL) {
    6203             :     /* Add a goto to implement the break. */
    6204         242 :     add_goto_for_break(sssep, &start_position, &end_position);
    6205             :   }  /* if */
    6206             :   /* Check for and ignore the final semicolon. */
    6207         242 :   (void)required_token(tok_semicolon, ec_exp_semicolon);
    6208             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6209         242 :   curr_construct_end_position = end_position;
    6210             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6211         242 :   db_exit();
    6212         242 : }  /* break_statement */
    6213             : 
    6214             : 
    6215        4631 : static void check_void_return_okay(a_boolean         is_implicit_return,
    6216             :                                    an_expr_node_ptr  *return_expr)
    6217             : /*
    6218             : A void return (one with no expression) is being used to exit the current
    6219             : routine.  If is_implicit_return is TRUE, the return was generated as
    6220             : a consequence of falling off the end of a function; otherwise, the
    6221             : program contained an explicit return statement with no return value
    6222             : expression.  Check that a void return is okay as a way of exiting the
    6223             : current routine, and also set *return_expr to point to an expression
    6224             : if a return value is implied, or NULL if not.
    6225             : 
    6226             : If the return is from "main", and main returns "int", a return value
    6227             : of 0 is created.  That is the defined behavior in C++ and C99 when control
    6228             : reaches the end of the main routine.  That behavior is also used in C89,
    6229             : in which such a return is undefined.
    6230             : */
    6231             : {
    6232        4631 :   a_routine_ptr     rout = current_routine_entry();
    6233        4631 :   a_type_ptr        rout_type, tp;
    6234        4631 :   a_boolean         issue_no_value_returned_diag = FALSE;
    6235        4631 :   an_error_severity no_returned_value_severity = es_none;
    6236             : #if COROUTINES_ALLOWED
    6237             :   a_coroutine_descr_ptr
    6238             :                     cdp = NULL;
    6239             : #endif /* COROUTINES_ALLOWED */
    6240             : 
    6241        4631 :   *return_expr = NULL;
    6242             :   /* Disable return value optimization in a function that contains a void
    6243             :      return statement. */
    6244        4631 :   { a_scope_stack_entry_ptr ssep= &scope_stack[depth_innermost_function_scope];
    6245        4631 :     ssep->return_value_optimization_possible = FALSE;
    6246        4631 :     ssep->il_scope->variant.routine.return_value_variable = NULL;
    6247             :   }
    6248             : #if COROUTINES_ALLOWED
    6249             :   if (rout->is_coroutine) {
    6250             :     cdp = get_coroutine_descr(rout, (a_source_position*)NULL);
    6251             :   }  /* if */
    6252             : #endif /* COROUTINES_ALLOWED */
    6253        4631 :   rout_type = skip_typerefs(rout->type);
    6254        4631 :   check_assertion(rout_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine);
    6255        4631 :   if (rout->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
    6256             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6257             :       rout->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_static_constructor ||
    6258             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6259             :       rout->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
    6260             :     /* Constructors and destructors have no return value. */
    6261             : #if COROUTINES_ALLOWED
    6262             :   } else if (cdp != NULL && (cdp->has_yield || cdp->has_coroutine_return)) {
    6263             :     /* In coroutines, an actual (implicit) return statement cleans up the
    6264             :        coroutine activation and does not relate to the return type. */
    6265             : #endif /* COROUTINES_ALLOWED */
    6266             :   } else {
    6267             :     /* Get the routine return type. */
    6268        2273 :     if (rout->has_deducible_return_type && !rout->has_deduced_return_type) {
    6269           0 :       deduce_return_type_from_void_operand(
    6270             :                                    rout,
    6271           0 :                                    /*keep_placeholder=*/!rout->is_lambda_body,
    6272             :                                    &error_position);
    6273             :     }  /* if */
    6274        2273 :     tp = rout_type->variant.routine.return_type;
    6275        2273 :     if (is_void_type(tp) || is_template_param_type(tp) || is_error_type(tp)) {
    6276             :       /* A void return in a void function is okay.  Unknown template-dependent
    6277             :          return type must be assumed to be okay.  Similarly, when recovering
    6278             :          from errors we assume the intended type would have been acceptable. */
    6279             :     } else {
    6280             :       /* A return without an expression in a non-void function.  Unless a
    6281             :          special case applies, this case deserves a diagnostic. */
    6282          13 :       issue_no_value_returned_diag = TRUE;
    6283          13 :       no_returned_value_severity = es_warning;
    6284             :       /* Check for a return from main. */
    6285          25 :       if (rout == il_header.main_routine &&
    6286          12 :           is_integral_type(tp) &&
    6287          12 :           f_skip_typerefs(tp)->variant.integer.int_kind ==
    6288             :                                                      (an_integer_kind)ik_int) {
    6289             :         /* main returning "int", so make it return 0. */
    6290          12 :         a_constant_ptr zero = local_constant();
    6291          12 :         make_zero_of_proper_type(tp, zero);
    6292          12 :         *return_expr = alloc_node_for_constant(zero);
    6293             :         /* Falling off the end of "main" is a special case that merits
    6294             :            reduced diagnostics.  An explicit return from main (i.e.,
    6295             :            "main () {return;}") doesn't get special consideration. */

    6297          12 :           if (!C_mode() || c99_mode) {

    6299             :                standard. */

    6308           0 :           no_returned_value_severity = strict_ansi_discretionary_severity;

    6310          12 :         release_local_constant(&zero);
    6311           1 :       } else if (rout->is_constexpr && !relaxed_constexpr_enabled) {

    6326           0 :                                                         es_warning : es_error;
    6327             :       } else {
    6328             :         /* Not "main". */
    6329             :         /* See if the diagnostic level should be adjusted for other reasons. */

    6346             :           /* Suppress a non-error diagnostic if this is an implicit return and

    6348             :         } else {
    6349             :           /* Get pointer to the symbol for the function name. */
    6350           1 :           a_symbol_ptr     function_name_symbol = symbol_for(rout);

    6380       14305 : static void return_statement(void)
    6381             : /*
    6382             : Scan a "return" statement and add it to the current statement sequence.
    6383             : The syntax is:
    6384             : 
    6385             :      jump-statement:
    6386             :           return expression    ;
    6387             :                            opt
    6388             :           return brace-init-list ;  // C++11 only.
    6389             :                  
    6390             : */

    6392       14305 :   a_statement_ptr    sp;

    6413       14305 :   return_pos = pos_curr_token;

    6471             : #if COROUTINES_ALLOWED

    6706             : static a_boolean conflicting_switch_case_ranges(a_switch_case_entry_ptr  scep1,
    6707             :                                                 a_switch_case_entry_ptr  scep2)
    6708             : /*
    6709             : Return whether the two given switch case ranges overlap.  The ranges may be
    6710             : single elements (e.g., "case 3:" instead of "case 3 ... 4:"), but at least one
    6711             : range boundary must be an integer constant (i.e., not an error constant and not
    6712             : a template-dependent constant).
    6713             : E.g., if I and J are template-dependent constants and x and y are integer
    6714             : constants, [x, I] and [J, y] will conflict if x == y.
    6715             : */
    6716             : {
    6717             :   /* Compare two ranges.  [a, b] and [c, d] don't conflict only if b < c
    6718             :      or a > d.  In common cases, the ranges degenerate to single elements. */
    6719             :   a_constant_ptr  a = scep1->case_value, b = scep1->range_end,
    6720             :                   c = scep2->case_value, d = scep2->range_end;
    6721             :   if (b == NULL || b->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
    6722             :     b = a;
    6723             :   } else if (a->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
    6724             :     a = b;
    6725             :   }  /* if */
    6726             :   check_assertion(a->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    6727             :   if (d == NULL || d->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
    6728             :     d = c;
    6729             :   } else if (c->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
    6730             :     c = d;
    6731             :   }  /* if */
    6732             :   check_assertion(c->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    6733             :   return !(cmp_integer_constants(b, c) < 0 || cmp_integer_constants(a, d) > 0);
    6734             : }  /* conflicting_switch_case_ranges */
    6735             : 
    6736             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6737             : 
    6738           2 : static void record_switch_case_entry(a_switch_case_entry_ptr        scep,
    6739             :                                      a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr  sssep)
    6740             : /*
    6741             : Record the given switch case entry in the structures pointed to by the
    6742             : associated switch statement (described by sssep).  At the very least, this
    6743             : entails adding the entry to the list of all cases associated with that switch.
    6744             : It may also involve recording the entry on a sorted list of cases, or recording
    6745             : the "default case" in its own IL slot.
    6746             : Finally, this routine also updates the control flow data structures as needed.
    6747             : */

    6881             : 
    6882           1 : static void case_label(void)
    6883             : /*
    6884             : Scan a case label definition.  The syntax is:
    6885             : 
    6886             : 3.6.1  labeled_statement:
    6887             :                 case constant-expression : statement
    6888             : 
    6889             : GNU also allows the "case range" form:
    6890             :         case constant-lower-bound ... constant-upper-bound : statement
    6891             : */
    6892             : {
    6893           1 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep;
    6894           1 :   a_type_ptr                    switch_type;
    6895           1 :   a_constant_ptr                constant_ptr;
    6896           1 :   a_constant_ptr                range_end = NULL;
    6897           1 :   a_source_position             case_position, constant_position;
    6898           1 :   a_boolean                     save_reachability =
    6899             :                                                    curr_reachability.reachable;
    6900           1 :   int                           switch_depth;
    6901             : 
    6902           1 :   db_enter(4, "case_label");
    6903             : 
    6904           1 :   struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack].contains_active_switch_case = TRUE;
    6905           1 :   add_stop_token(tok_colon);
    6906             :   /* See if we are within a switch body by looking at the entries in
    6907             :      the structured statement stack. */
    6908           1 :   sssep = find_enclosing_struct_stmt(/*find_switch=*/TRUE,
    6909             :                                      /*find_loop=*/FALSE);
    6910           1 :   if (sssep != NULL) {
    6911             :     /* Assume the case is reachable if the switch is reachable. */
    6912           1 :     merge_reachability(&sssep->start_reachable, &curr_reachability);
    6913           1 :     switch_type = sssep->type;
    6914           1 :     switch_depth = (int)(sssep - struct_stmt_stack);
    6915             :   } else {
    6916             :     /* We are not inside a switch statement. */
    6917           0 :     pos_error(ec_case_label_must_be_in_switch, &error_position);
    6918           0 :     set_reachable(curr_reachability);
    6919           0 :     switch_type = error_type();
    6920           0 :     switch_depth = 0;
    6921             :   }  /* if */
    6922             :   /* Ignore the initial "case". */
    6923           1 :   check_assertion_str(curr_token == tok_case, "case_label: expected case");
    6924           1 :   case_position = pos_curr_token;
    6925           1 :   (void)get_token();
    6926           1 :   constant_position = pos_curr_token;
    6927           1 :   constant_ptr = scan_case_label_constant(switch_type);
    6928           1 :   if (gnu_mode && curr_token == tok_ellipsis) {
    6929             :     /* This is a GNU C case range. E.g.: case 'a' ... 'z': */
    6930             :     /* Skip the ellipsis. */
    6931           0 :     (void)get_token();
    6932           0 :     range_end = scan_case_label_constant(switch_type);
    6933             :     /* Check that *range_end > *constant_ptr. */
    6934           0 :     if (range_end != NULL &&
    6935           0 :         constant_ptr != NULL &&
    6936           0 :         constant_ptr->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer &&
    6937           0 :         range_end->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer &&
    6938           0 :         cmp_integer_constants(constant_ptr, range_end) > 0) {
    6939           0 :       pos_error(ec_invalid_case_range, &error_position);
    6940           0 :       range_end = NULL;
    6941             :     }  /* if */
    6942             :   }  /* if */
    6943           1 :   if (switch_depth != 0 && constant_ptr != NULL) {
    6944           1 :     a_statement_ptr          sp;
    6945           1 :     a_switch_case_entry_ptr  scep = alloc_switch_case_entry();
    6946             :     /* Reload sssep because the statement stack may have been reallocated. */
    6947           1 :     sssep = &struct_stmt_stack[switch_depth];
    6948           1 :     sp = add_statement_at_stmt_pos((a_statement_kind)stmk_switch_case,
    6949             :                                    &case_position);
    6950           1 :     sp->variant.switch_case.switch_statement = sssep->statement;
    6951           1 :     sp->variant.switch_case.extra_info = scep;
    6952           1 :     scep->stmt = sp;
    6953           1 :     scep->case_value = constant_ptr;
    6954             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6955           1 :     scep->range_end = range_end;
    6956             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6957           1 :     scep->position = constant_position;
    6958             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6959           1 :     scep->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    6960           1 :     scep->colon_position = pos_curr_token;
    6961           1 :     sp->end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    6962             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6963           1 :     scep->reachable_by_fall_through = save_reachability;
    6964           1 :     record_switch_case_entry(scep, sssep);
    6965             :   }  /* if */
    6966             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6967           1 :   curr_construct_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    6968             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6969             :   /* Check for and ignore the final colon. */
    6970           1 :   (void)required_token(tok_colon, ec_exp_colon);
    6971           1 :   remove_stop_token(tok_colon);
    6972           1 :   db_exit();
    6973           1 : }  /* case_label */
    6974             : 
    6975             : 
    6976           1 : static void default_label(void)
    6977             : /*
    6978             : Scan a default case label definition.  The syntax is:
    6979             : 
    6980             : 3.6.1  labeled_statement
    6981             :                 default : statement
    6982             : 
    6983             : */
    6984             : {
    6985           1 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr sssep;
    6986           1 :   a_source_position             label_position;
    6987             : 
    6988           1 :   db_enter(4, "default_label");
    6989             : 
    6990           1 :   label_position = pos_curr_token;
    6991             :   /* Ignore the initial "default". */
    6992             : #if CHECKING
    6993           1 :   if (curr_token != tok_default) {
    6994           0 :     internal_error("default_label: expected default");
    6995             :   }  /* if */
    6996             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    6997           1 :   (void)get_token();
    6998             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6999           1 :   curr_construct_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    7000             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    7001             :   /* See if we are within a switch body by looking at the entries in
    7002             :      the structured statement stack. */
    7003           1 :   sssep = find_enclosing_struct_stmt(/*find_switch=*/TRUE,
    7004             :                                      /*find_loop=*/FALSE);
    7005           1 :   if (sssep != NULL) {
    7006           1 :     a_statement_ptr          sp;

    7009             :                                    &label_position);
    7010           1 :     sp->variant.switch_case.switch_statement = sssep->statement;
    7011           1 :     sp->variant.switch_case.extra_info = scep;

    7019           1 :     record_switch_case_entry(scep, sssep);
    7020           1 :     merge_reachability(&sssep->start_reachable, &curr_reachability);
    7021             :   }  else {
    7022             :     /* We are not inside a switch statement. */
    7023           0 :     pos_error(ec_default_label_must_be_in_switch, &label_position);
    7024           0 :     set_reachable(curr_reachability);
    7025             :   }  /* if */
    7026             :   /* Check for and ignore the final colon. */
    7027           1 :   (void)required_token(tok_colon, ec_exp_colon);
    7028           1 :   db_exit();
    7029           1 : }  /* default_label */

    7032           2 : static void label_definition(void)
    7033             : /*
    7034             : Scan and process a label definition.  (The current token is a label name and
    7035             : it is followed by a colon.)
    7036             : */
    7037             : {
    7038           2 :   a_label_ptr                    label;
    7039           2 :   a_struct_stmt_stack_entry_ptr  sssep = &struct_stmt_stack[depth_stmt_stack];
    7040           2 :   an_attribute_ptr               attributes = sssep->prefix_attributes;
    7041             : 
    7042           2 :   sssep->prefix_attributes = NULL;
    7043           2 :   sssep->contains_user_label = TRUE;
    7044             :   /* Scan the label identifier, and enter it into the symbol table if
    7045             :      needed. */
    7046           2 :   label = scan_label(/*is_definition=*/TRUE, /*is_declaration=*/FALSE);
    7047             :   /* See if the label has already been defined. */
    7048           2 :   if (label->exec_stmt != NULL) {
    7049           0 :     sym_error(ec_already_defined, symbol_for(label));
    7050           0 :     set_reachable(curr_reachability);
    7051             :   } else {
    7052             :     /* The label has not previously been declared, so put out the
    7053             :        definition. */
    7054           2 :     define_label(label);
    7055           2 :     stmt_update_source_sequence_list(label->exec_stmt);
    7056             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    7057           2 :     curr_construct_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    7058           2 :     label->exec_stmt->end_position = curr_construct_end_position;
    7059             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    7060           2 :     if (!C_mode()) {
    7061             :       /* Record the innermost object lifetime that this label is part of.  If
    7062             :          that lifetime turns out to be "useless," the label lifetime will be
    7063             :          updated later.  See fixup_curr_block_labels_and_gotos. */
    7064           2 :       label->exec_stmt->variant.label.lifetime = curr_object_lifetime;
    7065             :     }  /* if */
    7066             :     /* If there have been forward gotos referencing this label, check whether
    7067             :        any have jumped over initializing declarations. */
    7068           2 :     check_for_jump_over_initialization(label->exec_stmt,
    7069             :                                        &label->source_corresp.decl_position);
    7070           2 :     check_assertion(depth_innermost_function_scope > 0);
    7071           2 :     scope_stack[depth_innermost_function_scope].last_label_decl_seq =
    7072           2 :                                                   symbol_for(label)->decl_seq;
    7073           2 :     if (!C_mode()) {
    7074             :       /* Flag all enclosing blocks to "invalidate" their currently active
    7075             :          object lifetimes. */
    7076           4 :       for (; sssep >= struct_stmt_stack; --sssep) {
    7077           2 :         if (sssep->kind == (a_struct_stmt_kind)ssk_compound) {
    7078           2 :           sssep->label_invalidates_curr_block_object_lifetime = TRUE;

    7080             :             /* Don't propagate the invalidation flag out of a catch clause. */
    7081             :             break;
    7082             :           }  /* if */
    7083           0 :         } else if (sssep->kind == (a_struct_stmt_kind)ssk_try_block) {
    7084             :           /* Don't propagate the invalidation flag out of a try block. */
    7085             :           break;
    7086             :         }  /* if */
    7087             :       }  /* for */
    7088             :       /* Create an object lifetime to run from this point to the end of
    7089             :          the current scope.  It's needed to handle backwards gotos to
    7090             :          the current label. */
    7091           2 :       reset_curr_block_object_lifetime(label->exec_stmt);
    7092             :       /* Don't allow labels in C++14 constexpr functions (also disqualifies
    7093             :          a lambda from being considered constexpr). */

    7095           2 :         if (innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr->
    7096             :                                                        is_declared_constexpr) {
    7097           0 :           pos_error(ec_label_in_constexpr_function,
    7098             :                     &label->source_corresp.decl_position);

    7100             :              referenced.  */

    7104             :                                                                           TRUE;
    7105             :         }  /* if */
    7106             :       }  /* if */
    7107             :     }  /* if */
    7108             :   }  /* if */
    7109           2 :   check_assertion_str(curr_token == tok_colon, "statement: expected colon");
    7110           2 :   (void)get_token();

    7123           0 : static void upc_barrier_style_statement(void)
    7124             : /*

    7127             :     <keyword> <integer-expr> ;

    7207             : 
    7208       47998 : static void statement(a_boolean is_dependent_statement,
    7209             :                       a_boolean marked_as_gnu_extension)
    7210             : /*
    7211             : Scan a statement.  Add it to the current statement sequence.
    7212             : is_dependent_statement is TRUE if the statement is a dependent
    7213             : statement (of an "if", etc.).  If marked_as_gnu_extension is TRUE,
    7214             : this statement was preceded by the GNU keyword __extension__.
    7215             : */
    7216             : {
    7217       47998 :   a_boolean          prev_was_label = FALSE;
    7218       47998 :   a_boolean          get_another_statement;
    7219       47998 :   a_boolean          can_appear_in_constexpr_body = relaxed_constexpr_enabled;

    7221       47998 :   an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr
    7222             :                      entity_list;
    7223       47998 :   a_routine_ptr      current_rp = current_routine_entry();
    7224             : 
    7225       47998 :   db_enter(3, "statement");
    7226             : 
    7227       47998 : rescan_statement:
    7228       48002 :   if (struct_stmt_stack_top().p_start_pos == NULL) {
    7229             :     /* Record the start of the statement for add_statement: This takes into
    7230             :        account leading attributes or GNU __extension__ keywords (which are
    7231             :        consumed before calling add_statement). */
    7232       48002 :     start_pos = pos_curr_token;
    7233       48002 :     struct_stmt_stack_top().p_start_pos = &start_pos;
    7234             :   }  /* if */
    7235       48002 :   if (std_attribute_tokens_next() || curr_token == tok_alignas) {
    7236             :     /* Scan leading standard attributes. */
    7237           0 :     struct_stmt_stack_top().prefix_attributes = scan_attributes(al_prefix);
    7238             :   }  /* if */
    7239       48002 :   get_another_statement = FALSE;
    7240             :   /* Move cached #pragma declarations (if any) to the current scope stack
    7241             :      entry so they can be examined and acted upon in subsequent processing.
    7242             :      If we have already scanned a label, any pragmas between the label and
    7243             :      the statement may be added to the existing list.  Otherwise, the
    7244             :      list is expected to have been cleared. */
    7245       48002 :   if (select_curr_construct_pragmas(/*add_to_list=*/prev_was_label)) {

    7247             :        warning on unreachable code. */
    7248           0 :     check_lint_notreached_state();

    7250       48002 :   struct_stmt_stack_top().fallthrough_statement = NULL;
    7251       48002 :   switch(curr_token) {

    7254         969 :       empty_statement();

    7323           0 :     case tok_asm:

    7326           0 :       asm_statement();

    7566             : 
    7567       22729 : a_statement_ptr compound_statement_full(a_boolean   at_function_level,
    7568             :                                         a_boolean   explicit_return_type,
    7569             :                                         a_boolean   is_catch_clause,
    7570             :                                         a_boolean   is_statement_expr,
    7571             :                                         a_type_ptr  *p_result_type)
    7572             : /*
    7573             : Scan a compound-statement.  The syntax is
    7574             : 
    7575             : 3.6.2  compound-statement
    7576             :                 { declaration-list    statement-list   }
    7577             :                                   opt               opt
    7578             : 3.6.2  statement-list
    7579             :                 statement
    7580             :                 statement-list statement
    7581             : 
    7582             : Return a pointer to the statement created.
    7583             : 
    7584             : at_function_level is TRUE if this compound-statement is the body of a
    7585             : function (rather than an enclosed block).  In that case, the closing "}"
    7586             : is not swallowed by this routine.  This is unusual, but desirable in
    7587             : that it gets any error messages (like those for unresolved labels) to 
    7588             : come out on the closing "}".  If is_catch_clause is TRUE this is being called
    7589             : to scan the body of an exception handler.  The scope stack has already been
    7590             : pushed, but otherwise this is handled like an ordinary block (except that
    7591             : branching into it is disallowed).  If is_statement_expr is TRUE, this
    7592             : compound statement is the statement in a GNU statement expression (of the
    7593             : form "({ ... })") and the result type of that compound statement is returned
    7594             : through *p_result_type.
    7595             : */
    7596             : {
    7597       22729 :   a_statement_ptr            block;
    7598       22729 :   a_boolean                  any_statements = FALSE;

    8163         320 : void statements_init(void)
    8164             : /*
    8165             : Initialize static variables related to statement processing.  This is done as
    8166             : a subroutine (rather than relying on static initialization) so that it
    8167             : can be redone to compile more than one source file in a single invocation
    8168             : of the front end.
    8169             : */
    8170             : {
    8171         320 :   avail_control_flow_descrs = NULL;
    8172             : #if DEBUG
    8173         320 :   num_control_flow_descrs_allocated = 0;
    8174         320 :   cfd_id_number = 0;
    8175             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    8176         320 : }  /* statements_init */
